text: Love going here! My last two visits were decent. The server honestly, was rude, I do not remember her name; but seriously, every other time I have been here EVERYONE is so nice. Also, the potatoes seem to be slightly undercooked, again this is a more recent thing happening here, I am guessing there is a newer cook. The biscuits and gravy, Cajun omelet and the coffee are to die for!! Definitely somewhere you should try at least once, anyone I have every taken here has become a huge fan and always comes back

I love this place! Whenever I can convince someone to get up early and eat some awesome biscuits and gravy, it is the best day ever! Seriously, I recommend the biscuits and gravy... plus the atmosphere is pretty neat. Kinda reminds me of a Grandma who hordes country decor lol.... they have great food though.

This hit the spot for breakfast for sure. Classic country breakfast food taste like it was made at home. Great price.  Will be coming back. I gave it 4 stars because of the chair I was in lol our waitress was an older lady so was kinda slow but she had great hospitality that made up for it.
This was a wonderful find in Glendale AZ. Do yourself right by dining at this small but "big diner. We had the biscuits and gravy, the food was homemade and the service was grand.
Not a good place for a someone looking to sit and have conversation, you feel claustrophobic and the seating is to close for comfort.

Loved it!!! My first time here, and I can honestly say we got both good food and good service!!!  We had the muffins, cinnamon rolls, seafood omelette, and pancakes. Food was outstanding and the people were extremely nice.

Still a good place to grab some brunch. Always a good special on the board to be had. Service is always good, even when the wait staff is curt. Forget 'Donnie's' up on Peoria and come here instead. True gem in Glendale.

Kiss the Cook is so old school! Its a charming little place that's good to take the family or friends to enjoy breakfast. I use to live near by here and was first taken by people that raved about this place. I was surprised that they were right on about how good the food was. I am not a morning/breakfast person, but for Kiss the Cook I will get my lazy butt up to enjoy.
Love the small town and family owned feel of this place! The staff was sweet, attentive and prompt ...even on Mother' day!

Based on fellow Yelpers we checked out KTC this morning... Not too bad - Cute inside, we were in the back room which was a little dark... muffin basket that reviewers have noted was just small bran muffins... not awesome, but ok.  The staff (esp Donna) was attentive and the food came out quickly.  Definitely better than Denny's...

We happened to be in the Glendale this AM, and found this place on Yelp. It did not disappoint! They had fresh Hawaiian Hazelnut coffee, and we ordered a cinnamon roll to come out before the meal. Simply put, a slice of heaven...

The breakfast was also great, eggs, ham ,and biscuits and gravy, YEAH. I highly recommend this spot to anyone looking for a great breakfast in Glendale.
Cozy place. Good prices. Had the Cajun omelette not spicy and lots of flavor. Pancakes are delicious fluffy and buttery
YAY! Good food and such friendly people. Sometimes my partner and I don't get such a great reception but this place loves the GAYS!! Can't beat the prices either...will definitely be returning :)
Fantastic!!!  I just wished I lived here so I could eat here everyday!  Best pancakes ever!!!  Sit in Nicole's section, she is great!
This place has excellent breakfast. The biscults and gravy are amazing. Fresh coffee. The parking is a little small for full size trucks. Home style breakfast is a speciality here.
Delicious, home cooked breakfast. Susan our waitress was very pleasant and extremely efficient.  Visiting from California and will be back again for sure.

The food was good, but I am a stickler for good customer service. Unfortunately this place doesn't seem to have it, which is sad because it is very close to my work and we were looking for a good place to order our breakfast from in the mornings. The first time I went I was disappointed because I thought they delivered, but I chalked that up to a misunderstanding so no big deal. As I said they are very close to my job so picking up is not an issue. What was the issue is that when I arrived no one acknowledged me. There was someone there at the hostess desk that I was standing in front of, but she just stood there and kept doing what she was doing, no greeting or anything. Then she answered a call and took an order and then just walked away. I stood there for a little while until she came back and then acknowledged me. That rubbed me the wrong way, but again, I let it go because even though the restaurant wasn't busy at the time, doesn't mean they weren't busy with to go orders or something.  But today was the last straw, I called in to place another to go order so that my office could sample the lunch menu. The lady who answered the phone immediately asked if I could hold and I did for about 5 minutes and they hung up on me. This upset me, but I figured it was a mistake. So I called back and when the lady answered and asked what I would like to order. Before I placed my order I wanted to mention my issue with what had just happened. When I told her all I got was a kurt "sorry" and "you wanted to place a to go order right so what do you want". I decided not to place the order because I while I respect people in the service industry, I cannot respect or patron a restaurant whose staff has a complete disregard for its customers. Unacceptable.

I have driven by here so many times and have always seen how busy it is.  I decided to try it one day and I am glad I did. They serve these little mini muffins that come out hot and fresh. They were so delicious. I ordered the two egg breakfast which came with fried potatoes that tasted like my dad had made them and crispy bacon cooked to perfection. The eggs were cooked just perfect and nice and fluffy. 
It is small but very cozy and makes me imagine a small town eatery. The waitress was really great even though she was the waitress on the middle of the week day that I went. Will definitely go back again.

I don't make pancakes anymore because of this place, the food is always exceptional.

The service is awesome and always comes with a personal touch and a smile, if you want breakfast go here anytime its open it will be great.

There was about a 15 min wait when we arrived however it seemed like there was always a 15 min wait to be seated for people. Usually a good sign of a great place to eat, and in the end was worth it.  Food was excellent. Service was great too. Great little place to dine at.

I'm not really a fan.  The country cute decor is something I can get over but the food was overpriced, the service sucked and the place was super dirty.  We were sitting right next to the owners and if you can't get good service when sitting next to the big boss - it's a sign of trouble.  I would have given a 3 star but used the bathroom before leaving.  Well, I went into the bathroom anyways... didn't use it.  Totally disgusting and I have a feeling the kitchen isn't much better.  They should serve eggs-Benedict and french roast coffee to work with the country decor.  The place could be a gem but instead it's just a crapper

It's pretty good. Best part of all: instead of bread they serve mini muffins!! Yes, it is annoying how small this place is and that you have to wait a while if it is busy to get a seat. Then once you are seated it feels quite crowded. The eggs are just ok. I much prefer the pancakes and sweeter side of the breakfast menu. It's not bad.
Just awesome! Cute atmosphere and great service. Ginger bronie rocked! Muffins were delicious. Will definitely go back again. Thank you!

Fantastic little place. I had the create your own omelet and it was huge and very delicious! The mini muffins they give you are full of flavor. Ours were zucchini and I couldn't stop eating them. The crispy potatoes they came with my meal were some of the best taters I've ever had. I loved how crispy they were. I got a side of the Cajun hollandaise sauce and omg it was incredible! I was dipping everything in it. It's sooooo good. Good food, friendly staff, cute place. I will come back for sure next time I'm in town.
The food was absolutely delicious, the hot cocoa was fantastic and they sell their adorable mugs. Definitely a win for breakfast :D

Gone here couple times before and always like their garden eggs benedict. But this time I decided to change it up a bit and order their chorizo eggs benedict. It wasnt what I expected. Burnt, no pinto de gallo, pototoes was cold. Wasn't happy. My fiance got the corn beef hash, thumbs down. had to ask them to remake it. it was burnt yet soggy in the inside. overall not happy. used to be good. idk what happened. the cook probably had a rough morning. lol

Only been here twice but must we've had nothing less than an awesome experience. Amazing food and great customer service...no complaints here, woild highly recommend to anyone. Also luv the decor, and their doggie treats are great too im guessing, our little 4 legged friend always enjoys them.

Came for a friends birthday and had a great time. Nicole was a fantastic server and even got the whole restaurant to sing happy birthday to the birthday girl. Food was great and will definetly be back.

A lovely, charming breakfast place!  The menu was unique, the prices were excellent, and service was friendly.  The basket of mini-muffins was a great touch.  Our food was served hot and fresh, and it was clear that everything is "homemade" - nothing seemed canned, frozen, or store-bought.  Even the fruit was 100% fresh!  My only critique, which I know doesn't matter to some, is that the coffee mugs are very small and I had to keep requesting a refill.  But I will definitely be back here!

Kiss the Cook?  Shit - they should fire the cook!

I should have known before visiting that I wasn't going to like the place. After all, the AZ Repugnant rated this place as its #2 pick (behind Matt's Big Breakfast) as the top place to have breakfast in the Valley.  As the six friends who read my reviews know, I've never understood the hoopla around Matt's Big Breakfast - it's OK - but geesh -- #1?  What happened to The Farm at South Mountain -- now that's a unique-fantastic-organic-only-can-find-in-Phoenix-Phoenician experience.

Sigh - but I digress...

Ross and I enter "Kiss the Cook".  The interior is special - hard wood floors, mismatched seats and tables -- we both say it reminds us of a country store.  "Nana" is the one who shows us to our seats.  My hopes rise and I start thinking that AZ Republic scored on it's review.

We order.  Service is friendly, coffee was a little weak, but Ross loves the OJ.  Then the food arrives. 
 
The presentation is impressive.  My omelet was TALL!  FLUFFY!  Both Ross and I were wowed!  Then I cut into it and it was runny, soggy, and tepid (not really warm).  The waitress came by, asked how everything was (and she seemed to really mean it versus the polite ask but they don't really care to know the answer question that usually comes from waiters).  I told her about the omelet and she offered for them to recook it.  

She came back with my same omelet that must have been thrown in the microwave.  The top was steaming but interior now warmer - but not yet warm.   I picked around the soggy parts and ate the top (that was Ross' suggestion).

The waitress came back again, concerned that I wasn't eating enough.  She was so sweet.  I didn't want to make her feel badly.  But she sent the manager over -- which I thought was very proactive customer service.

The manager (maybe the owner?), stopped by and asked me what I thought might be wrong and offered up that it might be the egg beaters.  She did not offer me something else (but did suggest the next time I go in I should try the Pecan Cinnamon Roll).  And, when we got our bill, the omelet was still on it (they didn't comp my meal).

We paid and no complaint.  I don't expect to be comped, I just thought the experience with the manager was interesting.

Kiss the cook is by far one of the best breakfast places I've been to in a long time, the service is amazing, the food is to die for and the ambience of trinkets is just delightful. If you're in the Glendale area and want an amazing breakfast, kiss the cook is the place.
Went there for a nice Easter breakfast an the food was cold an the bacon was burnt would not tell my friends

Beeeeeeest Breakfast ever!!!!!!! The place is cute and vintage looking! The male waiters are very good looking white boys! Makes u wana put then on a plate and enjoy!! Very satisfied with this place! The waffle is to diee for!!!!

Great place for Sunday brunch, my mom and I didn't have to wait long. They bring out a basket of mini muffins prior to your meal, and the meal itself was Delicious. The service wasn't so great we has to keep waiving  down our waitress to refill our drinks. Other  than that every else was great

There will more than likely be a line for the indoor seating area because it is small, but there is a large patio that's open. The wait is for a reason because the food is really good. I recommend the Cajun Benedict because that Cajun sauce is especially good. Meal starts our with a variety of little muffins that are absolutely delicious as well. Great "neighborhood feel" to this place!
Shaded dog friendly patio with a nice clean water bowl!  I would come again just for that, but the food and service was great too.

I really wanted to like this place . It had a lot of problems like they miss up my order 4 times in a row . After the 3 time I just told the lady to leave it and the worker told no , it's not my food , I was like whatever.  There was only 7 ppl there and I got everyone else food but mine . The oJ was good and there dog meal are cute . I'll won't be back

Good breakfast place. Can't believe I hadn't been here after living in the neighborhood so long. I enjoyed the laid back feeling of the homey decore and really appreciated the peace and quiet of this restaurant compared to a lot of the obnoxiously loud and chaotic breakfast spots out there. My wife and I had their flavored coffee, on this day it happened to be a Hawaiian hazelnut which I really enjoyed. The mini muffins and butter were a nice touch and were just enough to not take away from the breakfast entrees. My review would have been 4 stars, but while ordering I asked our server if the corn beef hash was made in house which she said it was turned out to be canned. Not terrible, the meal was still good, but had I been informed properlyI would have ordered differently. Service was great otherwise and I will definitely return to try the New Orleans omelet with Cajun hollandaise. The description looked really good so I'll look forward to that upon my return.

Yummy breakfast options are slim around my boyfriend's house which is why I am so grateful for Kiss the Cook. We can all use a little kitsch with our breakfasts and Kiss the Cook has it in spades. Mismatched chairs and plates mixed in with country style antiques add some interest to your just awakening eyes. 

The food is tasty and homey. They start you off with a lovely basket of mini muffins (bran, strawberry and zucchini) which are piping hot and yummy. The zucchini is my favorite. They serve their coffee in clear glass mugs which I love because you get to watch the cream and coffee mix together. The food is really solid, I haven't had anything I didn't like yet. Their eggs benedict is quite good and their pancakes are really good.

The waitresses are friendly and quick with your order. The prices are fair. Now that its not an oven outside the patio is open so wait times have improved. In fact, over the weekend there wasn't a wait at all. This is a great, locally owned breakfast place to try out.

This place sucks the food sucks and so does the old ugly staff that serves it. I would rather starve. This place is called Kiss the Cook...but once you have eaten here you'll want to slap the cook!!!!! Save your money and avoid this place. It just isn't sanitary.
Quaint little place. I enjoyed the eggs benidict. The wee muffins are moist and delicious.  They also have a biscuit for fido. So sweet!
This place was so cute! The waitresses were super friendly and the food was amazing! Try their pecan cinnamon rolls...they are to die for! I will definitely be back!!!

We went to Kiss The Cook for first time two weeks ago. Even tho we had to wait it really was the 15 minutes we were told. The place was very crowded but server was friendly. Pretty good green chili omelette and Cajun eggs Benedict.  Went a second time last Sunday, this time the server was distracted, didn't bring the mini muffins until asked and coffee refills were non existent. We had the green chili omelette and special Burger Slider eggs Benedict which was English muffin -except not on mine, hamburger patties-the size of half dollars one undercooked  and one extremely overcooked, grilled onions-except not on mine, grilled tomato- one very thin slice for two eggs, eggs, sauce, and cheddar cheese-again except not on mine. The food came out 5 minutes apart with the Benedict first.  When we said something to the server about the missing parts of the Benedict her response was "Oh, I'm sorry".  That was it.  When we told the hostess/cashier about the poor food quality...same response "Oh, I'm sorry".  We tried to get someone from Kiss The Cook to acknowledge poor food, poor service and poor responsibility.  Never happened.  We eat breakfast out every weekend. We will not be returning to this place.
It is our tradition to have breakfest here every Christmas eve. Never disapointed, always satisfied, and filled with good food.

Like the massive three egg omelet but not happy with the ingredients used. Broccoli, jalape√±o, etc. should be fresh, not the canned option. Service is ok, prices are fair. Will definitely pass on this place.

What a great little breakfast joint! Usually pretty busy and has quite the wait. We've gotten lucky a couple of times but definitely await on weekends. That said it's well worth the wait. The food is made to order and tastes like something you'd get at grandma's.  I've tried the French Toast,  waffles pancakes and chicken salad sandwich and they are all heavenly. Depending what you are in the mood for I'd vouch for any of those. I love the interior it's very quaint. Tables with chairs that don't match, tea sets in the cupboards along the back wall. My mom, daughter and I love to go for a girl's day brunch once a month.

A charming place with really yummy fresh food and the mix of mismatched plates and decor really give it a homey feeling. 
If it's busy (and it usually is) get ready to stand while you wait for your table! There are less than 30 tables at KtC so it can get uncomfortably cramped while you're waiting to be seated.
This place is adorably quaint and the food is awesome. The muffin baskets that they give you are a nice touch. But the service was not so great and the food was slow to come out.

This is one of my favorite breakfast places. We used to go here all the time when I was a kid. I remember always getting their chocolate chip pancakes. Yum! We moved away from the area and hadnt been in a while. We drove by the other day and decided to drop in. Its just as good as I remember. Those little mini muffins that come with your breakfast are amazing and there omelets are really good. I saw that their special was pumpkin pancakes and Im going to have to come back and try those. They also have a new flavored coffee everyday. Really good. I love the decor, its just as I remember it 20 years ago. Its a cute little family owned place where they remember your name. Love it. Ill definitely be going back.
Amazing pancakes and great eggs . We eat at a lot of breakfast places and we believe a pancake should stand alone without syrup ! Their pancakes didn't disappoint

First time here and I will definitely be back! The food of course was amazing but what really made me want to leave a review was the service. Our waitress never let our coffee go half below and was very very sweet! And yes, those muffins!!!! Yum!
Amazing little place for breakfast!! Great food and the prices are not bad. Good service. The decor is sure to catch your eye!!!  Will come again.
The staff is nice, but slow. I have only eaten breakfast here. Nothing bad, nothing good. The food is bland and basic.
Today I'm having a omelette with ham mushrooms and avocado and mini muffins and like always good service

I hit this place with the family one Sunday on the recommendation of an Internet article, naming it one of the top 9 breakfast spots in the area. It was ok, and probably rates somewhere in the middle of that list. The decor is sort of homey and random with a dash of countrification; we were seated on the patio at our request and received good, patient, attentive service. It won't break the bank to eat here, but everything is a la carte, so don't expect any sides to come with your meal. The beverages are overpriced for the amount given (almost $3 for a 12 ounce cup of fountain lemonade? half filled with ice? O_o) but the food was decent. It's a unique place but not special, if you get my drift. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again, but f you're in Glendale and have a hankering, give it a try.

We are in town on vacation and had been searching for a great underdog breakfast spot.  Kiss The Cook was exactly what we were looking for!  The whole atmosphere was lovely and the decor was kitschy, including the mismatched chairs.  We had the most wonderful waitress, the omelets were great and pancakes were divine.  Of course the complimentary piping hot zucchini muffins didn't hurt either.  The best restaurant find we've had on our trip.
It's such a cute little place with amazing food. Unique little concepts too. Give it a try
Great good and excellent prices. We got our food to go but it was amazing. The huevos rancheros are so tasty.
If you are looking for pancakes, this is the place to be! These pancakes are so fluffy it's like eating clouds! The service isn't great,
Fantastic food! Great prices! Excellent service! Super dog-friendly! No bones about it, I'll be returning for breakfast as often as I'm in Phoenix!

Meh. I've experienced MUCH MUCH better.  Please keep in mind I have eaten here for several years now, but this past year has been a real disappointment.   The coffee is so weak any flavor you get is from the added cream.   The eggs benedict  was over cooked to the point where the yellow solid. So, I sent it back and was treated to runny whites the next time.   Clearly this is something they need to work on.        A few months ago we experienced the same exact problem which is why it took so long for me to give them another chance in the first place.  I, for one will not be going back nor can I, in good faith, recommend them.  Seriously, and I can't believe I am saying this, but Denny's is better.  Mimi's is REALLY my recommendation for a decent breakfast at decent prices. Last note, the staff was okay, but I ended up getting charged for the two coffees we had while waiting for food we never ate.

I've lived in glendale almost my entire life, this place is a gem. Love everything about it. The food is great (I always get breakfast), the servers are wonderful and the price is right. They even have homemade dog treats!

After passing this place countless Xs, curiosity finally got the best of me so we finally stopped in 2 give them a try. There were a couple other occupied tables being tended 2. It was mid~day so it probably gets an influx of business in spurts during other Xs.

   W8ed a couple min8es 2 b seated by a friendly hostess who seemed 2 b busy helping the w8ress(es) serve up orders/refills. Woulda preferred seating ourselves if not 4 the w8 2 b seated sign, instead of feeling awkward by the stares of the elderly patrons there but got settled in2 a centrally loc8ed small table. No booths in case u wanted 2 know.

   I guess I understand the draw of this place 4 those that want the old fashioned home~style feel but dining there felt like being @ a cross between a Brass Armadillo & an Elderly Care facility. Though I did like looking @ some of the antiques 4 sale there, just felt a bit strange ~ almost like they're trying 2 pull off the ol' Bobby McGee's concept w/ vintage items like victorian boots, tubs etc but geared toward the much older.

   Even tho I wasn't personally impressed or as comfortable as I'd like, everything was ok/tolerable part of our experience till we Eventually got acknowledged by our w8ress who acted as tho we were graced by her presence, snapping what~dya~want @ us. I almost replied: 'a different server'... but bit my tongue 1dering if this was just part of the 'charm'.

   I ordered the Vegetarian sandwich & my companion went w/ the Seafood Omelette w/ iced tea & tomato juice 4 our beverage as she briskly walked away huffing/puffing/snorting like a bull ready 2 impale a matador. The hostess came over shortly w/ our drinks & a 1derful basket of cute li'l assorted mini muffins which turned out 2 b the best part of our meal/experience here, esp the AWESOME zucchini 1s!

   Tomato juice was just V~8 in a glass & the iced tea tasted soapy & bitter. Don't know if there was soap not rinsed out in the cup but if it was straight from the tea dispenser, it was far more than soapy 'residue' & the tea part I could even make out, tasted like liquified mold so EWWW we reluctantly drank water instead w8ing 2 notify the hostess as we didn't want others getting sick or 2 evoke more wrath from the server who was intent on giving every1 hell. 

   When our food was ready 2 b served, she stomped over & musta mistaken our pl8es 4 frisbees as they were nearly flung @ us, mine almost skid in2 my lap!! Didn't ask if we wanted/needed anything else & was done w/ us till slamming our damages slip down when she was obviously ready 4 us 2 pay/get rid of us. The prices here might have felt like a pretty good deal if more of what we ordered was decent. Perhaps it was a case of we spontaneously picked a bad day 2 go w/ an equally bad cook & w8ress or maybe they were a couple till that morning & the break~up was gonna make every1 else suffer!!

   I don't know if our server was having the worst day of her life or what, but apparently any1 else who had the mis4tune of her w8ing on them was getting the same treatment, so I guess we weren't being targeted. I even overheard a guy @ her other table telling her 'I thought I did something 2 make u mad @ me'. I couldn't make out what else was said, but it was obvious the poor hostess/cashier was trying 2 divert any neg8ivity by joking it off as something else.

   The Veg sandwich was good (not gr8 nor bad but slightly better than ok). His Seafood Omelette made him spit in2 his napkin st8ing it was overly salty (probably trying 2 cover up what he called 'unfresh ingredients & bad seafood'). Leaving most of his pl8, was never asked if everything was ok or if there was a prob cuz it was blatantly apparent that the snapping turtle who could only bark @ people really didn't give a F*ck except 2 make others b the outlet 4 her nastiness!! We always treat our servers nice & respectfully, making things easier 2 b cleared (which they never were) & whatever the case was w/ this 1, she either needed 2 leave the drama @ home or better yet stay home OR here's a concept: not work in any scenario that involves having 2 interact w/ customers/public in any facet...

   Kiss the Cook? More like, kiss their (_y_) A$S & still get sh*t!  IF we ever Dared 2 give them another shot (highly unlikely after what we were subjected 2), we'd b certain that some1/ANY1 else w8ed on us. Actually, scratch that ~ we'd have 2 make sure she wasn't there, cuz I'm sure I'm not the only 1 who doesn't wanna jump every other min8 w/ her slamming/snappy mouth/throwing things while trying 2 eat... nor feel like WEARING what was ordered (which depending on what it is) might b better than actually eating it ~ YIKES!!

Let's see. It took 10 minutes before someone took our drink order. Then, for some reason, you are forced to wait for a basket of cheap dry muffins, before they will take your order. From the time we sat down, until the time we were served, it took exactly one hour. This is breakfast we are talking about. My over medium eggs, arrived over-hard. And the waiter forgot my toast. I sent the eggs back, and they punished me with some extremely Ronnie called very over easy eggs. I guess they just didn't want to make them over medium. I guess I'm a prick for thinking I can order food there way I like it in a restaurant. I will never go back to this place again.
Ok food. Pricing kind of high. Nothing special. Staff did not go out of their way to make you feel welcome. If Ian in the are I would go back. Not worth the drive from north side.

This is a good place to grab a nice quiet breakfast. Tried it for the first time last weekend. The price is fair, spent about $25 after tip for two of us. The food was delicious. The service was good. Had a ten minute wait to be seated at 11AM on a Sunday.

Our waiter kept our drinks refilled. Unfortunately their cups are so small that I required 4 refills, but I never felt neglected. Honestly the small cup thing scared me, that had real potential to screw up my meal if they weren't paying attention...but they were so it's all good.

I had a real generic breakfast of eggs, bacon, pancakes, and a side of toast. It was all very good. I paid the extra $1 for "thick" bacon, and that was totally worth it. My girl got cornbeef hash and eggs, and she thought it was very good.

Next time I probably will try the "New Orleans Omelet". Sounded good, but at a new place I usually go generic to test the water, and get fancy my 2nd go around.

 Impressive breakfast, I probably would've kissed that cook.
Loved it. Friendly, efficient staff. Warm, welcoming decor. Delicious food - nothing fancy and perfect portions. Very affordable. Exactly what we were looking for. We'll definitely be back.
My fist time here I really liked it I had the cook plate The buttermilk pancakes where  so good .  it's way better than Denny's & IHOP and all those big chain companies . Oh and is way cheaper too !
Always great breakfast!  The chocolate chip pancakes are amazing and the muffins are spectacular!

We had a great breakfast! We had the garden bene and the country breakfast. Both were excellent! The staff was very friendly and helpful. We only had to wait a few minutes even though it was busy. We will definitely be back!

Yeah, this place is awesome. I had a combo eggs and pancake and their pecan roll. It's all awesome. Super fresh tasting and just really, really good. Pancake is light, pecan roll is pretty divine. People who work there are pretty friendly too. Would definitely come back and bring a morning date too.

man what to say about this place the little muffins are good hot bought some to take home but so good when there not hot order omelette and waffle start of with waffle it was a little bland just OK  now the omelet there was just something not good not sure but they could of been eggs from a carton the potato's that come with the eggs tasted boiled or freezer burn the server is what made it 3 stars she saved the day will come back and try lunch
We use to come here for breakfast, they use have friendly staff but it's not the same anymore, not impressed what so ever.  But their food is still good.

Perfect way to spend a Sunday morning! Great pancakes and eggs.
This place is small and cozy.  
We took two small dogs and ordered from the Doggie menu which has several good 
options to choose from.
This place is family owned and operates with pride!  They make sure you feel welcome and get what you came for!
Highly recommended if you want good food inside or out and if you want to take Fido...
Little bit of a wait. Food is good nothing fancy. fresh and delicious. muffin basket is excellent.

My sister was visiting and I wanted to take her somewhere special for breakfast. Kiss the Cook from what I read online sounded like a great place. When we got there it took a little while for service to begin. I actually had to ask someone for some attention. We were a large table of ten. Boy, once our waitress came she made up for the wait. The food was great and so was the service. It was a special meal, a unique place and the food was wonderful. Everyone at our table kids included were satisfied and happy. I highly recommend Kiss the Cook for a special breakfast spot.

I have visited "Kiss the Cook" several times and I always get a bakers basket warm mini muffins with butter. My favorite are the mini brand muffins. My boyfriend loves the Cajun eggs Benedict. He refuses to try anything else. Staff is wonderful!! I always see the same servers working every time I visit. Makes it feel like one big family is eating breakfast at grandmas house. Absolutely love "Kiss the Cook"

This place is just so good! We used to go to the Good Egg but since we had a bad encounter with a very rude server we haven't brought ourselves to go back. 

We get stuck in routines when it comes to restaurant so finding a new breakfast joint seemed like it would take forever. I binged and found Kiss the Cook. It is kind of a drive for us but I have been wanting to try something new. 

The outside doesn't appear to be anything special but I was wrong. The inside of the place is just gorgeous. I love all the many different tables and chairs and even those fluffy little cat miniature figurines. The servers are pleasant and quick and I have no complaints so far. 

The food is delicious! Great big helpings and it isn't greasy! My daughter and I almost always devour the scrumptious muffins but we try to refrain ourselves in order to save room for our food which is delicious. 

Definitely worth a try. Great service, atmosphere, and above all a great breakfast!

Our friends took us here for breakfast and wow they picked a winner. The food, no matter what you get is all out of this world!

They will let you know they fear the lightrail expansion though.

A small cozy restaurant the food was really good it was a busy day but I felt our waitress could've been more friendlier. I think overall we really liked this place and the basket of muffins are so yummy that's a seller. Only reason I give it four is because trying to pay was the hassle. The cash register is so close to the door and people waiting the people cut in front of you and you're just taking forever to check out

Kiss the Cook is a cute little breakfast nook in Glendale. I ordered the Corned Beef Hash, which came with has, two eggs, and potatoes. Also, they give you a basket of mini muffins for the table if you order certain items from the menu. The mini muffins are a nice touch and the bran flavor is best in my opinion. The corned beef hash was tasty, however it was a bit oily and greasy for my taste. Potatoes were really good as well. My one complaint was the portion sizes were a little small. Usually I have a hard time finishing everything on the plate, but here I ate everything and was still left feeling a little hungry. Overall, Kiss the Cook is worth the trip if you are in the neighborhood.

Gosh, this restaurant is so cute and absolutely delicious. They bring you out free muffins while you wait for your breakfast. You can tell that it is family-owned and that they take pride in this restaurant. The prices are really great and the service always is too.

Loved this place! We sat on the patio with our dog and he received just as amazing of service as we did!! They even had s menu for him. 

I got the eggs Benedict and it was great! My husband got the stuffed french toast and I was almost sad that I didn't get that after stealing a bite of his.

The owner was our waitress and super nice!  We sat outside on a perfect October morning.  Great selection, great prices.  It has a more "homey" feel than other places and I love that they leave a pitcher of water on the table.  I had the pecan cinnamon roll which was delicious!  My friend had the 3 cheese grilled cheese and pasta salad which was also yummy.  My other friend had an omelet which came with a basket of mini muffins.  The zucchini one was the best!  They even welcome dogs in their outdoor seating area.

Everything was made on the premises & you can really tell the difference! Excellent mini muffins (zucchini & pumpkin are my favs!) & really enjoyed the Garden Eggs Benedict (with mushrooms & spinach)! Country potatoes were very good too!

Good food, reasonably priced, good service. These are important factors when I consider if I will return to a place of business. 
Hour wait time was not too long on a Saturday morning. There was coffee and water outside for those waiting to be seated. When we got inside it was a little crowded but the food was good. I ordered the Cook's breakfast (might be called something else... this was a couple days ago).  It came with pancakes, eggs, sausage, and the mini muffins. The mini muffins are my favorite part-like most people's, specifically the zucchini ones.  I will come back!

Large menu, good breakfast, decent coffee. Muffin basket is usually really good but sometimes you get all of the same flavor instead of an assortment. Avoid the cinnamon rolls...too dry and harden while you are eating them.

We really like this restaurant, but do not go there more often, because their coffee is just not good. We tried it again this morning, and love the restaurant, the food, and the service, but the coffee is still not good,it is weak, not very flavorful, and this morning tasted a little burnt.

I'll never go back there. Pricey, overrated and we just felt out of place. The "eclectic" atmosphere didn't make up for the unwelcome feeling we had. Never again. There are way too many places that deserve our hard earned money. The food was forgettable!

Excellent place for breakfast! From the hostess to the wait staff they make you feel right at home! The food is fantastic and if you want to substitute something it's fine with them. Mom and I keep going back. Try it you'll find a new eatery...

went to KTC for beakfast and the menu was amazin, love the muffins and the omelets are great. the price was very good and the coffee is very good. nice old house down south feeling. I will go back again to try the lunch salads,  they look amazing.

This is my new favorite breakfast/brunch place! Their Cajun style Benedict is amazing, the sauce is good and spicy! They offer a daily flavored coffee and give you a basket of mini muffins to munch on while you wait for your meal!
The country gravy is excellent and the mini muffins are dangerously good.  There was a bit of a wait but less than 15 minutes.  Has an interesting atmosphere with all the antiques.

We waited about 15 minutes. As soon as we were seated our waiter greeted us and asked for our drink order, he returned in a few minutes. Then returned a few minutes later to get our order. We placed it. I ordered Huevos Rancheros and the wife ordered a Cajun Omelette. Both were wonderful and had lots of flavor. Your meals  come with a Baker's Basket, three different types of mini muffins fresh and warm, all three were great. These are brought to you before your meal while you are waiting. Our food came within minutes of finishing the basket. Quick, great service and food. We will return again. Great first experience.

This is definitely my new favorite breakfast spot. The service is absolutely wonderful and the decor is the most quaint thing I have seen! They start you off with fresh mini muffins - bran and zucchini walnut and they just melt in your mouth with the butter spread on the warm muffin.

Had the special of the day - omelet with swiss cheese, ham, spinach and garlic and oh my goodness was it delicious.

We ordered a cinnamon bun to share and it was so yummy, covered in caramel (but not too sweet).

Definitely must go!

This restaurant was cute, quaint, and had fantastic service.  I had the French toast, but I'm still obsessing over the freshly squeezed orange juice (which was delicious).  I definitely would recommend this place for a great breakfast.

Back in the day I would have gave Kiss the Cook a solid 3.  Not any more.  The last few times we've been there have been worse and worse.  The last visit was the final straw.  The bakers basket ( a few muffins) were undercooked.  YUCK!  The eggs were cold and dry.  The potatos were still hard.  Even the service was no good.  I dont know what happened to this place.  It used to be a cool dive for breakfast.  Not any more.  The two comments about slapping the cook and firing the cook are spot on.  The real punch in the gut was that there was a poster on the door that was begging patrons to go online and request that they be casted on DDD.  I emailed the link but instead of asking them to use Kiss the cook on an episode, I urged them to avoid eating there at all costs.  Get it together.

I was very pleasantly surprised by my first visit to "Kiss the Cook". My family and I visited for the first time on a Sunday. The restaurant is instantly welcoming and cozy. The place smelled like coffee and muffins. The menu had a lot of tasty dishes I would love to try next time I visit, like crepes and pancakes but I went with an omelette and home fries. I enjoyed my food. The food, the service, the atmosphere all felt like the staff  cares about the experience the patrons have.  Did I mention the muffins? They offer a complimentary basket of mini muffins for the table with certain dishes (I think that's how it works, I'm not sure).  The muffins were warm, moist and delicious. The coffee is served in glass cups.  I prefer mugs but I appreciate that they have a signature thing.  I wish the coffee was better but it certainly wasn't bad. I also liked that they offer flavored coffee.  The place was full when we visited.  It's a really nice, laid back restaurant and I look forward to coming back. I would have come sooner but when I would see their signage from the car as we drove by I was worried because it seemed a bit outdated.  I didn't know what that would mean if we went inside.  Upon visiting, my experienced proved to be very positive.  I like this place.

I had the corned beef hash and eggs.  Lose 1 star for unseasoned potatoes.  Gain it back for scratch corned beef.  Lose two stars for weird ambiance.  I get the look they are going for, but the chairs were down right uncomfortable.  Gain 1 star back for great coffee, and frequent refills.  I think that gets me to four.  Very well priced-good value for the money.  Service was wonderful.

The wait can be long. The food is good and mini muffins are fabulous!
The restaurant itself needs a good cleaning.
Service is ok.
A place to try at least once.

This is the most charming place to eat for breakfast. Delicious food. Awesome service.  We had pancakes. We had eggs. We had omelettes. We had the pecan roll. You name it. Fresh squeezed oj. Bacon. Sausage. Everything was fantastic. You will not be disappointed. We will be back!!!

It's just ok in my book. My omlet was good, as were the potatoes. My husband ordered the corn beef hash and upon ordering he asked if they make it from scratch, waitress said, "yes, it was." We think it's canned and then doctored up. My kids had a ham sandwich, also just ok. I think the best part about breakfast was the fresh squeezed juice.

What a cute little spot! Very homey. And the staff were friendly. Cute little country style place. Couldn't resist the mini muffins while we waited. Delicious! We will be coming back again and again. It was busy but the service was impeccable.

Excellent breakfast place. It was so pleasant with the old knickknacks and great service. You could tell their were a some regulars when we went. The food was good, and I'm not a breakfast person. Happy 33rd birthday!
If you're ever in Glendale and you need to come to a breakfast spot this is the place it has a very charming feel. The menu is small but most of the things are good.

I was not sure what to expect when I found this little place.  But what I found in a restaurant where the food is good, the help is friendly, and it definitely has a personality!  

First, the food is good,  I have eaten there twice with a friend and both times our food was cooked to our specifications, was tasty, and was served quickly.  
This is no austere setting.  The tables and chairs are all different, there are shelves holding all manner of things ranging from older kitchen ware, cutsie signs and at the register, they sell home made dog treats.

The food is well portioned, and the coffee was pretty darn good.  
  
The only reason this is not a 5 is that the entry way is cramped and confusing.  They are doing the check out and greeting area in the same small place.  It does not work well for me.

Wait staff seemed like they were having a hard day, snapping at each other and not overly friendly to the customers. The basket of mini muffins was the best part of our meal. Just regular breakfast fare, nothing special. Restaurant could have been cleaner, not in a great part of town. Homeless /transient population hanging out in the parking lot, made it feel somewhat unsafe.

We enjoyed breakfast there yesterday morning. Our server Steven was fantastic. The food was incredible. My son got the cinnamon roll, I got the strawberry stuffed French toast, and my daughter had the banana pancakes. They cooked the bananas in the pancakes which was unexpected but was very tasty. The cinnamon roll was phenomenal, the stuffed French toast was great but was stuffed with cream cream and the strawberries were on the outside still good though. 

The service was great, food was great, and it was a beautiful morning so we sat on the patio and it was overall a great experience. 

The only downfall was the kitchen was backed up so it was quite a long wait for the food but at least the server kept us informed about he hold ups. Communication is key and it was worth the wait.

Hi,

I will admit the name was what enticed me to visit Kiss the cook. I am sure I am not the only one who has done this. Anyhow, upon walking in I really liked the cozy ambience. The waitresses all have that mom-like-feel. What is that you ask? They were all aged enough to be my mom. Super adorable and sweet. I felt so catered to and loved on by complete strange older woman. 

As for the food; Menu is very simple and pretty much comfort food or anything that will fill you up and make you feel like a stuffed sausage. Upon being seated you are greeted with a smile and a basket filled with their house muffins. I ate one or five. I cant remember, but they were warm, moist and delicious. Overall, portions are very generous. Food had great flavor. 

It's pretty easy. If you want a good breakfast or lunch and you are in the area this is definitely a place to visit. They have an outdoor pet friendly area, spacious indoor seating and a wonderful vibe. 
Oh, and when you are provided with the check, you are given "kisses" Hershey Kisses. 

Great for a meet up with friends, family or solo date. 

XOXO
B

Kiss the cook is an awesome restaurant. It is locally owned and the food is really amazing. Its quaint with antiques and homemade desserts. I ordered the biscuit and gravy meal. It came with a bakers basket, a small basket with 6mini homemade muffins. They were piping hot and delicious. My meal came with potatoes, eggs and biscuits and gravy. I added 2slices bacon for only 1.75. My husband had the Cajun omelette it had a spicy hollandaise sauce. He devoured the whole thing. 

Everything tastes like it is made from scratch and very fresh. If you are in Glendale you need to check it out. They are open until 2:30 so plan accordingly.

Love their home like feel to their restaurant. Something bout their muffins and coffee make my mouth water. I'm up and out early every morning so their early opening time is wonderful for me. The only thing that is disappointing is the lack of space between seats and tables. It's very crammed. I've still come back though.

Cozy and comfortable with eclectic mismatched tables and chairs and lots of interesting decor on the walls.  Went for a late breakfast when we flew in from the Midwest to see my 92y/o mother who was visiting my brother.  Definitely a better choice than visiting her in Buffalo, NY this time of year.  Independent diner with great omelette choices, especially the Jalape√±o & cheese, as well as traditional breakfast choices (Eggs Benedict).  OMG!!!  Added to the muffin basket, you've amped the comfort food level to the stratosphere (in addition to excellent handicapped accessibility).
The best eggs benedict I've had in a longtime. Sooo good! Definitely recommend them. Also the mini muffins were delicious. Staff was very nice and accommodating as well.

I would rate a 2.5. Our very first experience was amazing a week ago, food was great the cinnamon pecan roll was to die for smothered in the pecan Carmel sauce. service was excellent. Thought this would be our go to place from now on for breakfast with my Wife. But our next experience was not so amazing. Service was really slow, the food was not the same and the cinnamon was not made like it was the first time not so much of the pecan sauce on the roll very disappointed. took a long time to get the attention of our waitress, it appeared that they seemed to cater more towards the regulars that they knew by name. Not sure if we would be returning in hopes it was just a bad day.

Food is very fresh especially the fruit. Was surprised the menu said seasonal fruit and they actually brought out seasonal fruit and it was fresh. Watermelon.... Yum everything else was standard. I had an omelet with tomato, broccoli and light cheese. Delicious! And a Belgium Waffle which was nice and fluffy. I could only eat half of everything but it was delicious. 
 I didn't have any protein but I had my Shakeology this morning No Worries.   

Www.shakeology.com/msjeter

Will be back!

I will start by saying food is very good yet a little overpriced in my personal opinion. Still 5 star worthy for food quality. I took one star for the service. The server was a little rude and cold(maybe she had a bad night sleep, who knows) and seemed bother by first timers asking about menu items. 

Had the biscuits and gravy. All very fresh and tasty. Coffee kept coming in not by our server by someone else, strange but il keep it. 

Overall i might try this place in the future.

Best breakfast place in Phoenix!!! Hands down. Had an egg white Cajun omelette. Unbelievable!!!!! And the pancakes where off the hook. A great place to be at. 
They prefer cash. Keep that in mind.
Very home feel place. Good was amazing. And the muffins were to die for. They had mis match chairs to sit in which made me fall in love with it. It is a small place so it gets busy and packed quick.

First time here. First impression. Antique mom and pop shop style of decor and atmosphere. Figured the food was going to be okay at best, but it was way better. The potatoes were nice and crispy, the eggs were perfectly cooked, the cornbeef hash had a nice crispy top layer to it. The price was fairly inexpensive and the food was perfect temperature. Overall a great first experience. I will be returning

Went here for breakfast and its pretty good. They have a cute, southern, sitting on the back porch, kind of vibe. I had the veggie benedict w/ the hollandaise on the side. And I really have no complaints. I tried to "tweek"
 my order (i.e. avocado instead of mushrooms) and it didn't come out as requested, but it was a busy Sunday morning so I pushed my mushrooms to the side of the plate and kept it moving. The world didn't end and my food was still edible. My friend had the veggie omelet and corn beef hash. I tried his corn beef hash and it was pretty good. It was my first time ever having it so I have nothing to compare it to, but it worked for me. All in all, Kiss the Cook is a cute little breakfast/brunch spot with pretty good food and I will definitely give it another try.

Delicious country sausage gravy! Probably the best I've had! Tastes just like Grandmas homemade! Great service and a very friendly family feel for breakfast! Kids enjoyed every bite! Will definitely return for breakfast!

This had been on my saved list for quite some time. The staff was very friendly and I love the random decor. Mismatched chairs (intentional) and fun interior. Coffee was hot and fresh. Mini muffin basket was a great because while I like to have a savory breakfast most of the time I always want a little something sweet in there, but I don't want a whole side of pancakes or French toast. So this was nice. They weren't amazing muffins, but they were all I needed. Breakfast came out fast. I like more unique options on the menu. My husband got the new Orleans omelet and that was delicious. I had the omelet that was in special. They were both Uber fluffy, cheesy and delicious. The home fries were also seasoned well and very tasty.. No bland potatoes here. Overall I would say a 3.5 but that's not an option in here. If I was in the area I would go back in a heartbeat, but I wouldn't make a trek across the city for it.
We stopped here for an early breakfast and the food was really good. The atmosphere is laid back and the staff is nice. We loved the muffins with our meal too!

Very great breakfast place. We were very pleased with Susan (our waitress). She gave us the best service and it was also very busy this Sunday morning. Coffee is delicious. Yes you can have a whole waffle for just $1 more and it's worth it.

lEveryone raves about kiss the cook.  It's ok but there are some other places just as good.  Menu is fairly limited.  Muffins come with each order.  Waitresses are fun and sassy.
Place is usually crowded when we go in.  Like I said, everyone goes crazy over it but me and for me it's ok.
I Love omelett And this place Is one OF the best omelletes, todays special Is Good. this place is amazing from the customer service  and food

This place is adorable, it reminds of a sweet little Granny's home! Our server was as kind as could be & started us off with some delicious muffins that we devoured. I ordered their biscuits & gravy which was pretty good! I would try them again. My toddler loved looking around at everything in the restaurant. Would come back for breakfast.

This place has been around for a while and for good reasons. They have affordable and delicious food. I've only ever had their breakfast and everytime it has been delicious. I recently went two weekends in a row and both times did not dissapoint. The first time I got their Cajun Style Eggs Benedict. I ordered mine over medium. The eggs came out perfect and the sauce they use in lieu of hollandaise was to die for. I mean I just want to smother all my food with it. It was the right amount of spicy and the right amount of flavor. The breakfast comes with their world famous mini muffins. The second time I got their traditional breakfast with pancakes. The PANCAKES are amazing. Fluffy to perfection and just topped off with enough butter. I also ordered a waffle and let me tell you. I loved the Waffle. It wasn't overtly sweet and it was crispy on the outside. They have applewood smoked bacon that is pretty delicious. The only negative thing that I can say about this place is that their coffee sucks. Sometimes you get those clear glass coffee cups and you can see straigh through it with coffee in it. I love strong strong coffee and even Denny's serves stronger coffee than this. The service at this mom and pop place is amazing. Every single employee makes you feel at home. They treat you like family and are great at making food recomendations. Overall, this place is good, cheap and delicious. Don't let the long line scare you away because it sure does get busy.
Delicious food and very nice servers. The food is reasonably priced and they aren't stingy with their portions. Cute place and you get mini muffins

It's Mother's Day and I knew restaurants would be crowded.  Imagine my surprise when this restaurant says they take reservations!  They say it was a 45 minute wait at that time, so I put my name down for 45 minutes.  We hurried to get there on time and they said it would be 20 minutes for a table... pardon me?  You said it was a reservation and now there's a 20 minute wait ON TOP of the reservation time?  After waiting 35 minutes with 2 very hungry children (I asked for some muffins for them and was given one for each of the kids, and then a waitress saw them cranky still and gave them another one, which was nice) we were finally seated.  The hostess asked if the table was fine and I had to bite the insides of my cheeks to keep from saying, "It'll have to do because I'm not waiting longer for another table!"  We saw people that got there after us in 4 party tables get seated before us because they were complaining.  WTF?  If they can't wait their turn, there's a Sonic down the street with no wait.

Anyway, we were seated and ordered quickly.  My 6 year old got the Cooks Combo, my 3 year old got the yogurt parfait (we changed the fruit to strawberries and bananas because they used honeydew, cantaloupe and pineapple in theirs, which sounded gross and a concoction that would result in curdled yogurt if the pineapple was fresh!)  I got the crab cake eggs Benedict (it was on special), and my husband got eggs with turkey sausage and potatoes.  We were given a basket of cold muffins, which were tasty but not piping hot like Missy's review.  The food came out quickly, which was surprising because they were quite busy.  Our waitress was a very nice lady and welcomed the change in the yogurt parfait (I really hate when waitresses get snippy if you change something very slight!)  Everyone was happy with their food.  I was mildly annoyed that the eggs weren't poached properly, they were overdone, resulting in no glorious egg yolk mixing with the Hollandaise, but other than that I would order that dish again.

We probably won't be back again though because it's a bit of a drive, a long wait, and I felt like I was stuck in a Seinfeld episode (a mesh of the car reservation episode and the Chinese restaurant episode).  The service was friendly, the food was good, but if you can't keep reservations, don't take them and sure as heck don't offer them!

I really liked this place. It's your typical diner food, pancakes, Omelets, steak and eggs, but they're actually very satisfying. The inside is a little small so thankfully it was a cool morning for the patio. The people are very friendly and helpful. Great place and good food! We'll be coming back again :)

The food wasn't bad but it wasn't anything special either. The five of us each got a different dish so we can have variety. The best was the eggs Benedict. Pumpkin pancakes had too much cinnamon. I got the corned beef hash which was over salted. Definitely prefer the corned beef hash at The Place. They had fresh squeezed orange juice on the menu but when we asked, we were told it was out of the box. I ordered a side of thick cut bacon which turned out to look like regular bacon. We were reassured that it was wider then the other bacon. I don't like this false advertising of menu items. The only saving grace was the mini muffins but I'm not sure if its worth a trip back. Maybe if I happen to be around the area.
Very cute and cozy. Perfect for Breakfast on a Sunday morning. Prices are affordable and the quality of the food was great. Will definitely be back!

Yes, they do serve mini muffins.They are good but you are now charged for them. After new 2018 wage increase passed.I seem to always leave hungry from here.Waitresses are mom like women.50/50 sometimes the service is good y sometimes it is not. Same w the food, portions are small y prices are not. Saw waitress clear table of dirty glasses y not wash hands. Stick fingers inside new glasses to put on table. That is not safe as it spreads germs from previous customers. I'm very picky about cleanliness w dishes y spreading germs. Maybe happens at other places too, but since I seen this myself, have not been back. Flu season is strong here in Az. Y I'm going to be safe to avoid it. Will not be in a hurry to come back to this place.
Loved this place.  Had an excellent scramble.  Potatoes were fantastic.  Bought a mug.  Best breakfast I have had in years.

What a beautiful and eclectic place to eat. The decor is so lovely and country, they have all of the little pieces I'd love to have. I love this cafe! However I do have a bit of complaint about the cleanliness of the restrooms. As for the food it's basic. Simple omelets and simple breakfast foods. Some items are more tasty than others and some items I simply cannot try. The coffee was great (however no non-dairy options for creamers) Come check it out for yourself and you be the judge. I'll still come back again.

It's is a cute place and gets a good crowd. I think the food is okay. It is not served as the average place and definitely has a home cooked feel which makes it better, but I think it's average. Maybe lunch is better than breakfast.
Great little breakfast spot. Come early because it gets full.  I've been coming here for years whenever I am on that side of town. It has never let me down. Good old fashioned home cooking.

I have gone here a couple times and both have been good experiences. Family place and very busy! Went with friends and we all enjoyed our food and left full. The price is reasonable and the food is brought out quickly. The servers were nice older ladies. Delicious gray and biscuits! Would suggest trying them yourself!

I found this restaurant on Yelp and it was quite an experience. This is a very small place but they also have an outside patio. The place is very unique and full of antique decorations (which some are for sale). I went on a Monday late morning and the place was full! we had to wait a little to be seated. The food was good, the bacon was nice and crispy. The pancakes were soft and fluffy but a bit small compared to other breakfast places I've been too.(nothing bad) Deepening on what you choose, they give you small muffins, the muffins were delicious! However, I did find their coffee to be very light , it lack a robust taste. Over all this is a great place to have a good breakfast! The menu prices are very reasonable, and once again their decor is super cute.

This is possibly the most adorable looking restaurant in Glendale. You walk in to what looks like an antique shop with a grandma's dining room kind of look. They offer a large dog friendly patio and the Facebook page says to ask for the dog menu so I really wanted to love this place. 

They started us off with fresh hot just baked mini muffins of two varieties one tasted like vanilla cake with chocolate chips the other was some sort of spiced muffin. They reminded me of box mixes.

My cajun chicken caesar salad arrives. The greens look fresh and crisp and the garlic parmesan breadstick looks like cheesy toast. I tasted the chicken and it taste very salty and over marinated like processed chicken from Costco. It might be the teriyaki flavor topped with too much salt. The taste of it made my stomach upset. The one thing I tried that was delicious was the crispy cheesy toast they gave me. They should feature that toast on the menu because it was unique and tasty. It was kind of like a crispy grilled cheese. I had to share it with my husband because there were some issues with his meal.

My husband had the breakfast special. It was missing the green onions and tomatoes that our waiter said would it would have. The eggs were fine but the pulled pork under the eggs lacked favors and the muffins underneath needed some toasting because they were very soggy. Lastly they forgot to fry the potatoes. It seemed like someone took a baked potato cut it up and just threw it in the oven. This made the potatoes very dry like chalk.


Sadly I have to kiss this place good bye!
went for first time week ago.. wont be our last.. wait staff very nice and food very good... enjoyed the experience

Super cute breakfast spot in Glendale! Delicious food! Also dog friendly on the patio and they have their own menu.  Staff is friendly and the setup is like being at nanas cozy home! Definitely recommend coming here for breakfast!

We finally had a opportunity to try this place after all the rave about it. We have heard nothing but good things about this place. So we came in expecting the best. There is no doubt about it! Place is popular, a lot of people were there! The decor is very over powering, stuff everywhere! Looks like a bunch of junk to me? Any way I'm not there to look! I am there to eat!! All three of us had breakfast, the usual! Biscuit and gravy, eggs, hash browns, bacon, skillet, and I had the waffle. Food was good, there is no doubt about it! You will not be disappointed in the food. But is was not the best!! I have had much better. So we walked away satisfied, and would come back. But don't tell me this is the best place around.
Yummy, yummy for the tummy!  Check out this place and for there awesome food!  We had Oscar roll, homemade chili, crepes and a KTC hamburger with home potatoes.  All good and friend, welcoming staff.
Great spot for breakfast. Service good, coffee stayed flowing. Everything I ordered was very tasty. Try the cinnamon roll. It's A +

This place is wonderful. Everything I have gotten there is wonderful. Their omelettes are huge. I've had the Cajun, and pulled pork which is awesome. I've also had the Cajun style eggs Benedict. Everything I've ordered has come with a basket of mini muffins. Make sure to try their cinnamon pecan roll, my wife and I usually share one. The service is sometimes a little slow, but with good food, who really cares. Next time your debating between one of those chain restaurants and this place for breakfast, go here.

Not impressed - food was flavorless. The set-up was cramped but cute vintage and unique. Wait staff looked run down but were nice. My corn beef hash was mushy with uncooked veggies.  The basket of muffins was okay but dry. My wife's biscuit and gravy was bland and cold, potatoes had no seasoning. We wasted $30 and the only pleasant was the wheat toast and my son's pancakes. Even the bacon was soggy and it is hard to hate bacon. We will not return.

Our first time here. After watching check please Arizona on PBS I thought I would give it a try. Had the New Orleans Cajun Omelette accompanied with grandmas fried potatoes. It was outstanding! 
A cute, antique-cluttered restaurant offering the west side commendable breakfasts and lunches. 
Sandwiches, which are served in bags can be accompanied by homemade soups, salads and desserts. Earlier in the day, we love the French toast.
And most entrees come with a cute little basket holding a variety of tasty mini-muffins. It's that kind of extra touch that truly makes you feel good. 
Definitely will come back looking to try the Eggs Benedict cajun style.

Absolutely the best omelet I've ever had...made with fresh eggs (from the shell), fresh squeezed Orange juice and delicious basket of miniature muffins (3-4 types.)  My brother had pancakes -and they claimed they had these best pancakes in the nation - and he agreed (he just wished he had ordered more!)

Waitress was extremely friendly, service was excellent. We were seated immediately, the dining area is small but not crowded, very cozy. Drink order was taken as soon as we were seated. Special of the day was shared when we were served our drinks. Muffin basket came out very hot with a nice variety of mini muffins and butter. Seasonal mini plates were provided for our muffins. Mine was a really cute Santa. My sister had a snowman. Order was taken and served in a very timely manner. Waitress kept our drinks hot and full. Serving portions were perfect, not too much/not too little. Our comfort and needs were a priority.
We love this place!! Great homemade food and awesome service!!. Oh, and the biscuits are a treat!

Just started working in this area, and first day the boss says, that he is going to be in late so you can wait a few hours to come, since I wanted to be early and was already in the area, and skipped breakfast to get there on time, I was starved and this place looked like a good breakfast spot. I was wrong.

It was a GREAT breakfast spot. Service was fast, polite, and the food was great. I got the make your own omelet with the potatoes and some coffee and tea. The coffee mugs are unique compared to any place I have ever been to, they are a clear glass mug. It was a bit different. Overall very very good. I just kind of relaxed and enjoyed my meal, no rush it was very good, and the portions were pretty hefty, you can never tell what your going to get at these smaller places. So I was pleasantly surprised. And my check was less then $15.00 so not to shabby for the portion sizes. And i almost forgot they give you this basket of these delicious little tiny muffins, these things are like biting into heaven. They were so good. Pretty sure they are complimentary. 

This place has a real small town feel to it, you could tell allot of the people inside were regulars. Everybody seemed really friendly. 

The only reason this place didn't get five stars, because the parking lot didn't really have a good parking set up to get in, I had to walk around the building across the porch which was kind of dirty and could use a coat of paint or protection, and I didn't see any handicap spots...if they were there the signs were not very visible. That and it could use a good thorough cleaning on the inside, lots of nick knacks and stuff up, they are all pretty dusty. Could use a good cleaning. 

Over all thou, a real good experience I will be back for sure.

Food was average.  Service was friendly but bad. Multiple small mistakes.  They changed the special after I ordered (steak to chicken) but never told me about it until I complained., no apology was offered.

Came to this place because I noticed it had 4 out of 5 stars. And I love trying local joints! This place is super cute, quite quirky decor to match the cute name. We got seated right away, not crowded but then again it's a Thursday morning. Our waitress really didn't have a personality. I notice there are 3 servers and the other two seem really attentive to there tables. 

Food was good, not overly impressed. The grandmas basket was cute a little different. Will I come back? Yes if I was in the area. Not gonna drive out of my way.

I brunched at this quaint little diner recently with a friend and was not disappointed. 

I ordered the corned beef hash and she, an omelette off the specials. Everything was great, and the warm little muffins were excellent! Make sure your order comes with the baker's basket.

Our server was very cheerful, and prompt. The atmosphere reminded me of eating breakfast at grandma's house, a happy feeling to be sure.

Had the meatloaf special, was very disappointed in the portion size, it was 1 very thin slice of meatloaf that fell a part and they put it back together on the plate. Maybe 4 bites.. My friend looked at it and was thinking the same thing I was... Got to be kidding me, it was very close to close, I think they should not of served it..

Great little spot in Glendale!

If you hadn't noticed, the West side (make that all sides...) is a strip mall wonderland.  When I got to Kiss the Cook, I was pleasantly pleased to see that it was a free standing building (guess I'm easily impressed) with plenty of parking and even a cute patio!

The menu was full of typical breakfast favorites including omelets, pancakes, and hearty breakfast indulgences.  

5-star service!  Our coffee was never low and our water glasses were always replenished.  The decor inside was similar to my Michigan grandma's basement which made everything seem extremely relaxed.  As other Yelpers noted, the muffin basket is a highlight.  Once you order you are greeted with a little warm basket with several different types of miniature muffins of love.  mmm

I love that when you get your bill (cheap too by the way!), you are greeted with a real Hershey's kiss!  These are the touches that are always forgotten with chain restaurants

I know I will return-
totally worth a try if you are on this side of town

Kiss the Cook is stellar in some ways and just misses the mark on others, which in my book rates it a solid four stars. I have been eating here since high-school and find this little family owned restaurant charming.

In addition to their regular menu (you can order breakfast or lunch any time), they always have three or four lovely specials. Generally, one is any omnivores dream, one takes fruit to a whole new level, and the other features one of their baked products done up to the nines.

My personal favorite is the "build your own" omelet. The ingredients are all super fresh, the omelet is always stuffed, and the house potatoes that are served on the side are very yummy (although I would like them done a little more on the crunchy side). My sisters favorite is the Snow Pea omelet. She swears it is the perfect combination of crunch and fluff!

Each meal starts out with a little basket of mini-muffin heaven. Alas the mini biscuits are no longer served, but man oh man are those zucchini muffins out of this world.

So you may be wondering, after all these raves, what are the down sides... well on occasion there is a little more butter on the bottom of the plate than I am comfortable with and although they are supposed to be famous, their sticky buns aren't all that special.

If you are looking for decent food, served with a smile, in a unique environment - you will definitely enjoy your visit to Kiss the Cook. Oh and there is that little chocolate kiss that leaves you wanting more...  : )

Very vintage and cute! The food is so good including the fresh mini muffins provided before your meal! Zucchini is my fav! Really good omelets and potatoes, sweet customer service! It's a bit small so I'm not sure how they fit people in if their busy but well worth going!

Solid place. 

It's a pretty down home breakfast spot in an iffy part of Glendale. We sat outside on the patio, much more comfortable than the crowded indoors, on a nice Winter Sunday (the only downside to being outside is some traffic noise which I think is tolerable).

Breakfast highlights were GREAT ham, pancakes, omelets.  Highly touted pecan sweet rolls and muffin basket were fine, but overhyped. Potatoes were fine but nothing special.  Prices are very reasonable. 

Oh, and the waitresses are super nice. Always tip well!

We stopped here for lunch today on our way home from outlet shopping. My mom had heard about it and so we decided to try it. Obviously lots of regulars as they all seemed to be known by the waitresses. It several minutes before we even got water and when our waitress did bring water she was less than friendly. No greeting and no offer to ask if we had questions or to tell us about the specials. I ordered a BLT and the bread was barely toasted. It came with a bag of Lays potato chips. My mom had the chicken salad over fruit and the fruit was not very good. Also came with a muffin which turned out to be Mini muffin. We then ordered the dessert special which was an apple dumpling and recommended by the waitress. It was okay but a little burnt! Lots of clutter and junky stuff as part of decor. Needless to say we won't travel to Glendale again to eat there but the locals will likely keep the place in business!

The pancakes, waffles and muffins are all good delicious but the pancakes are some of the best - you know crisp buttery ends and all fluffy inside.  The sausage and bacon are also delicious and so are the home fries. 

You can't go wrong with this place for breakfast if you're on the westside but it's also popular so be prepared to wait.

Charismatic little diner with good service and good food & coffee. Will be back to keep enjoying a delicious fresh american breakfast menu. They were busy yet we sat down quickly and food came on time...

I will keep this review short and sweet:

Come here. 

The staff was extremely friendly and attentive. The waffles, crisp on the outside and fluffy on the inside. I ordered the biscuits and gravy (my wife had the waffles) and it was delicious. The biscuits were fluffy and not super dense like other places I have been. 

Oh, to top it off, you get a little "Bakery Basket" with a bunch of mini muffins. They were warm and scrumptious too. 

Usually, i write longer reviews, but I think this place should be experienced on your own. Just know, it is awesome (and seriously, get the waffles)!

We took an Uber to the Fiesta Bowl and our driver pointed out Kiss The Cook as the best breakfast spot in Glendale. Not that I was looking, but KTC had not even been on my restaurant radar. Now, I'll be the first to criticize the Yelp community for having 400+ reviews of 'hip' breakfast joints but it's pulling teeth to get info on certain businesses or restaurants off the beaten path (generating user-content Yelpers, c'mon!) but not being aware of KTC and it's 100+ reviews is entirely on me there, friends. 

There was a short wait when we showed up from estate saleing on Saturday morning but the staff was friendly and had us in shortly. I had the New Orleans Omelette and Jenny had the special with the Maple Sausage. All the food was excellent, the service was excellent, and the prices were reasonable. Not a lot of bells and whistles (the mini muffins are a wonderful touch) but KTC is an elite down home breakfast restaurant. 

I can't stress enough how much every other "country kitchen" type restaurant can learn from KTC. Understated and over-performing if how I'd describe KTC. It's not the place I'll take my trendy out of town DINK friends after a night at [insert popular Scottsdale club with 600+ Yelp reviews], but it'll definitely be an upgrade for my Cracker Barrel & Denny's dining parents when they come to town.

Had breakfast here Sunday. It was such a great experience. Everyone was happy, and smiley. The food was great, and not pricey. They have very cute concepts such as the muffin baskets, and "kisses" they give you with your bill. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great food and a happy atmosphere.

Loved this place lots of cute decorations good service awesome basket of muffins come free with your meal. The breakfast was great and the owner or chef was making homemade pumpkin butter while we were there. All said great place for breakfast.

Fantastic little breakfast place!
Great food!
Mostly great service!
If you want a locally owned and operated breakfast tradition, this is the place!

Food is always good, but it can vary greatly by how good your waitress is. Also, if you order green chiles on an omelet it comes as a whole one on top--not diced as a stuffing inside. The baker's basket of mini-muffins is always great, but it would be nice to get an occasional blueberry one (they always seem to run out way too early).
Even tho I had a bad customer experience, I can't deny  how good the food is....I love places that has Mom's homemade taste to it....and they have that....I love recommend....I do...I do
