I wish I could remember my servers name but she was awesome! Those warm mini muffins are delicious! Love this Glendale breakfast spot! Did I mention those muffins!

Nice MA and PA business.  Our waiter was on point. He continously making sure we had everything we need. Unlike other waiters/waitress who only do it in the beginning. The muffins were moist and delicious. We ordered French toast with the Applewood bacon. They were cooked just right.  Our favorite breakfast place.

Every time I come here it makes me feel like I'm at home. Everything from the cute little nicknacks, to the basket of homemade muffins, to the homestyle cooking and to the service. Everything about this place says welcome home to grandmas house. Lol. Love this place! If you're looking for a 5 star classy restaurant then this might not be the place for you but if you are looking for an affordable home cooked meal the. Your at the right place!

Definitely worth the wait!

We just flew in from Atlanta so our bodies were ready for lunch but in AZ it's still breakfast time so thanks to Yelp we found this amazing place!

Do not let the outside appearance deter you...it's very quaintly decorated inside with an eclectic mix of antiques and baskets and mismatched furniture. We were thankful to be seated in the back corner at a cute antique round oak table where we could observe the happy customers being served by a very friendly, however, very busy staff since it was a Saturday morning. 

Their signature mini muffins served to every table were bran, zucchini and pineapple today and they make their own apple butter to go along with the butter served in the muffin basket. We were each able to taste all the flavors as our basket held six muffins. 

My husband ordered the breakfast special which was The Sonoran Pork Omelette with a chile verde sauce served with melted Monterey Jack cheese over the top. Since his initial craving was for Costa Vida this was a perfect brunch option and I had a hard time keeping my own fork off of his plate!  They literally whip their eggs to create the thickest fluffiest omelet we'd ever seen!  He also ordered a side of biscuits and gravy which were very good with a sprinkling of table pepper although I personally like more flavor in my gravy, the biscuits were amazing. 

I ordered the Belgian waffle combo with blueberries which was served with the perfect over-medium eggs I requested and the most flavorful thick crisp bacon I think I've ever tasted. My only critique would be that for the cost of the berry option I would have thought there would be more than 20 small blueberries on my half of a waffle. 

Sandy was a very friendly and attentive server and was assisted by an equally friendly nearby server when our water glasses were close to empty. 

We would absolutely recommend this uniquely quaint restaurant if you ever find yourself anywhere near Glendale...about 15 minutes from the PHX airport.

I have now been here 3 times.  This place is sort of an icon in Glendale and I had been hearing that I had to go here since I moved here 17 years ago.

The first time I was here was Mothers Day. and I ordered the special breakfast of chicken crepes with a fruit bowl.  It was cold, the spinach had the texture of shoe leather, the Alfredo sauce had separated then formed a skin.  The fruit bowl it came with was ok as was the coffee and the mini muffins with butter were really good.'

The next time I went for lunch and had that day's special which was a  hot turkey sandwich with potato salad.  The sandwich was ok. The potato salad was bland but the seasoned salt on the table made it ok. 

This last time I had the Cooks breakfast of two pancakes, two eggs, two sausages (or bacon) and I added some potatoes.  The breakfast was lukewarm.  The pancakes and potatoes were pretty good, the eggs and sausage were just ok.  As noted before the mini muffins served with real butter were really good.

Ever body I encountered was pleasant.  The place is looking a bit worn.  When I was there the place was one to two thirds full.  I noticed this last trip the line of chairs and the coffee station outside were missing.  I fully understand that the banter between the waitresses and the regular customers is one of the things that brings people back, I just wish it didn't cause my food to be served lukewarm as I saw other plates served that were still steaming.

I gave it a 3 but it is a pretty weak 3 and although I would go there again if somebody else picked it I doubt it will make it into my regular rotation.

This is a wonderful family restaurant. The food is delicious, fresh and hot. It's comfort food with nice size servings. My husband, son and I ate breakfast/lunch there today.
Our waitress was warm and friendly. She was kind, welcoming and service was outstanding.
I ordered the seafood omelette with home fried potatoes and vanilla flavored coffee. My husband ordered the corned beef hash, fried eggs and home fried potatoes with coffee. 
My son ordered the special: chicken sliders with potato chips. Our friendly waitress brought us a hot from the oven basket of mini muffins. 
It was a treat to eat here and we will be back.
I loved the restaurant and dining area--it's very quaint and comfortable.
Good fresh and home cooked food. Loved breakfast especially biscuits and gravy Small quaint place that does get busy. Decent pricing.

Yummy Yummy Yummy!!! We found this place one Sunday while doing a google search because all of our regular places had too long of a wait and boy did we hit the jackpot! Very cozy local place with great service and good food! The staff is so friendly and nice and they truly care about how you are doing and how you like the food...such a nice change of pace. Meals come with a basket of mini muffins that are so good you'll have to be careful that you don't fill up before your meal comes out. I've had the Buttered Cinnamon Roll with Pecan's and I dream about it it's so good! Melts in your mouth, fresh and delicious :) I typically order the eggs benedict but we've tried the biscuits and gravy, pancakes and this past trip my friend had the crepes which were sensational! 

A great little spot worth the wait when there is one!
Great food! Good service and love the decor....  So cute! I'll be back for the Cajun Eggs Benedict!!

We drove quite a way to this restaurant because hubs wanted to try the Cajun Omelet. He was not disappointed and challenged his need for spicy. I had a the snow pea, mushroom, and water chestnut omelet. Three of my fav things and a very nice treat. The basket of muffins were fabulous and I'm embarrassed to say I hogged them all. Only 4 stars because hubs said the coffee was pretty weak.

Place is adorable we came in got a table right away than made our order 10-14 mins later two more tables are witted next to us and made their orders and got served before us I Order Huevos rancheros and yuck just not my cup of tea  everything on my plate was chop big chunks of potatoes big chunks of tomatoes and onions everywhere just could eat it of how moist the "fried tortilla was " the muffins are amazing the iced coffee was also outstanding the servers were really nice other than that just stay away from huevos rancheros .

Great food. Great  service. The waffle was tasty. My Tom omelet was awesome. Our waiter was on top of everything.  We didn't need anything he's awesome.  We went to this  restaurant because we saw it on a TV show. the kids enjoyed the Hershey kiss at the end. We would definitely come back again

This rather seedy restaurant makes up for it in friendly good natured staff and delicious (breakfast) food. Have only eaten here twice, as a once-a-Year snowbird, and both experiences were very positive. The special this year was Cajun omelette which was indeed special, and the veggie eggs Benedict delivered. Don't wonder why you came, just salivate in anticipation!

Loved this place! We were in town with our pup Maggie and saw this place is pet friendly. The food was delicious and the staff was very friendly. They had a dog menu which was so adorable. Thank you to everyone at Kiss the Cook
Loved this place!  Delicious food and great service!  I just wish I actually live here so I can go every weekend!
First time here after passing it for years. Had the New Orleans Cajun omelette and it was great. Good friendly service.

Great little local place the portions are a good size and the prices are good I just had a pecan roll while it was a little dry on the outside packed a flavor punch. The wait staff was very friendly and efficient my coffee cup was never empty. I will definitely ruturn for a full breakfast
Great coffee, delicious basket of muffins and biscuits and gravy. Courteous staff. Highly recommend it!

Loved this little joint! It's intimate but cute. I had the combo of eggs. Bacon and biscuits with gravy. The biscuits and gravy were outstanding! The eggs and bacon perfectly cooked and the coffee fresh!
Hubby went with an omelet and home fries which he enjoyed enough to not want me to have a bite of! Food hoarder! We met one of the original owners as he likes to visit with people. We had a nice discussion and I'm looking forward to going back again. They also give out a basket of muffins freshly made. Can't wait to go again.

I took my daughter here for a girls day on Sunday. The place is so cute inside, not at all what I expected from the outside. It is drenched in country decor, but in a good way. I love how stuff did not match perfectly, like the chairs and the plates.

They were actually closed when we arrived at 1:06 pm, but they gladly encouraged us to come in. The Hostess was a young lady that had a down to earth friendly personality and even complimented my daughter on her necklace. Our server was just as lovely and was very attentive the entire time.

I ordered the eggs benedict ($7.50) and my daughter ordered a turkey sandwich on sourdough ($4.50). They delivered the delicious muffins that were mentioned in the previous post...we had banana nut and zucchini muffins and they were sooooo yummy.

The food came out in no time at all and was very very pleased with the benedict and the potatoes that came with. The eggs were perfectly poached and hollandaise sauce was delish.The potatoes were just like I make at home, perfectly seasoned with  little crispy pieces here and there. I was impressed because I have paid a lot more for this elsewhere and did taste nearly as good. The daughter's turkey sandwich was stacked high with thinly sliced turkey and cheese and she was also very satisfied. 

I will definetly return here and would recommend trying it if you are in the area. The service and the food were both great and that is no easy task.
Great omeletes! Service was a bit short handed; yet they did a marvelous job. VERY busy place; I can see why!

This was the best Breakfast I have had in a long time. The food was so good I didn't even get a chance to take a picture. The server was a sweet elder lady and she made us feel comfortable and welcomed! I highly recommend Kiss the Cook!
Got the oatmeal very good put nuts and granola in it and came with muffins . Old vibes
Delicious coffee the food is good especially the eggs benedict place is always clean and friendly can't go wrong with the muffins also
Pancakes are very good but as for everything else...... Quite terrible. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone under the age of 65.

Kiss the cook is a small, quaint- and I wanna say local but I'm not sure- breakfast/brunch restaurant in Glendale. A lot of their breakfast menu items come with a fresh basket of delicious muffins. 
I have tried the mushroom, ham and onion omelette and it tasted very good. The Cooks Combo is the best bang for your buck and comes with eggs, pancake, and sausage or bacon. Coffee and orange juice are both decent.
Serive is consistently good but they are pretty busy on Saturday and Sunday mornings.  So make sure to go early or call to put your name on the list. We once waited 20 min outside in the Phoenix summer heat.

EXCELLENT and known for their PANCAKES!! Amazing! All breakfast items are very good including their omelettes. Don't go to a restaurant that specializes in breakfast and expect their lunch to be good. Went there one time for lunch and would've rather had a sandwich from a hospital cafeteria. Eight years of going there for breakfast. Great price and serving sizes.

I've been here several times and think today was my last. 

They have a great idea here, the older sweet servers, antique furniture and decor - overall ambiance.

The food has been good enough for me to visit on more than one occasion but nothing I've ever been to crazy about. 

On my visit today, I ordered the crab cake Benedict and my girlfriend ordered the biscuits and gravy. My food came out cold and I sent it back, wasn't apologized to or checked back up on. I was on the fence about this place already and that tipped it. You are a restaurant - one job. Make good food and if it isn't - make it right! You guys had a wonderful opportunity to have me come back again in the future, but when I told the cashier about my experience it gets even better!!

When I told her about my poor service she basically said sorry and cut me off to find our server to make sure we were charged properly for my girlfriends turkey sausage. She spent more time trying to make sure we were being charged for the sausage than our experience. 

Biscuits and gravy were good though! I would recommend checking something else out - seems like quite a few yelpers agree.
Great breakfast, great service, great food,  the Biscuits and Gravy are the best I have had in AZ.  The Omelet was phenomenal.  We will definitely return! OFTEN.

I've been here a couple times whenever I visit Arizona. Out of all the places I've been to, this joint stood out the most! It's probably because of their wonderful basket of delicious mini muffins! I seriously loved all of them and could have finished a whole basket by myself easily! They had lemon poppy, pistachio, and cinnamon? I think.  The first 2 were my favs. 

Service
It wasn't super busy when we came, which was a Saturday afternoon around 12. The waiter that took our order was really nice and funny! I forgot his name.. He was also really attentive so thank you for that! He refilled our water without us asking, checked up on us, cracked a couple jokes. It was nice for us out of town people. 

Food
You MUST get the Cajun eggs Benedict. It's the right amount of spicy, and was super amazing! 
Biscuits and gravy- it didn't have any sausage and was okay... I didn't really care for it. 
Yogurt parfait- loved the fruits and yogurt! Really refreshing. 
Pecan pancake? I forgot the name. It was drowned in some sweet liquid/syrup. I had a bite and it was Waaaay too sweet for me and I love sweet! Maybe better for dessert rather than breakfast/brunch. 

Super cheap for 6 people compared to Cali! It was $60 without tip... Well worth the money!

This was our first time here. The restaurant is eclectic and fun, similar to Cracker Barrel but more unique. Our waiter was STEVEN and he did an excellent job. Kept coffee and water filled. I had the Cook Combo which was perfect. Eggs Benedict sauce was kind of different tasting... probably won't get that again. 
One of the earlier reviews said it was dusty inside but I didn't see a speck of dust anywhere. We will be back!

It's Saturday, mid-morning. You just woke up, your stomach is rumbling, and you decide that you're in the mood to go out for some brunch. Somewhere with a typical diner menu like Denny's, Waffle House, or IHOP would probably be good, but you're wanting to try something new. You're craving that warm comfort of a mom-and-pop diner that you just don't get at a chain restaurant. Look no further, because Kiss the Cook fits the bill! Kiss the Cook is a classic, eclectic restaurant near downtown Glendale that offers great food, a unique environment, and even better service. Winning the award for best breakfast from the popular and respected "Phoenix New Times" magazine on more than one occasion, Kiss the Cook is a restaurant that will have you coming back to satisfy your hunger many Saturdays to come.
Came hungry and left happy, full, and knowing I will be back! Great atmosphere, service was awesome, and food was exactly what I wanted.

AWESOME!!
Pros
Service was unbeatable!
Super friendly!
Food was great with good portions.
Prices are fairly inexpensive.

Cons
A lot of decor on the wall 

Overall awesome experience!
Good breakfast, not expensive. First time there and I will go back. Breakfast was big and coffee was good.

Excellent!  Superb service and wonderful food. We discovered this place about 5 years ago but had never ate lunch there always  breakfast. The lunch is every bit as good as the breakfast. This is a must do every time we are in the Phoenix area.

Just the best place. The food is outstanding, especially the complimentary zucchini muffins. The Service is great too. We were third in line and only waited a few minutes. Would have been even faster if it weren't for two rude twenty something women with a baby. When we walked in they had finished their meal, and their check was on the table. But they sat there visiting for at least another 40 minutes oblivious to other customers waiting for a table. Where does this generation get off thinking that the world revolves around them and to heck with the wait staff that needs to earn a living. If I weren't worried about being arrested I would have yanked them out of their chairs by their hair! BRATS

Solid choice for breakfast in downtown Glendale.

Kiss the Cook has been around since I can remember and it was always a place my mom would take us for a girly breakfast or lunch. Once my dad caught on to the fluffiness of their omelets it became a family favorite.

It had been years since I had been back but the husband and I were in the mood for breakfast and since we are westsiders and slow to wake up on the weekend we knew we wouldn't be able to make it to the east valley to try something different.  Matt had never been to Kiss the Cook so it seemed like the perfect choice, the fact that there was a meat lover's omelet on special confirmed that choice. When he asked to sub the green onions in the omelet for something else, he was greeted with enthusiasm and encouragement from the waitress, "Yes! you are paying for it, might as well have something you like in it!"  This instantly won over my husband who often asks to sub or omit ingredients.

The baker's basket is a great touch and I have always had great friendly service. Our food came out promptly, fresh, and our drinks never ran dry. Best part we were in and out in 35 minutes which helped us still be able to enjoy a full day of errands, despite not rolling out of bed until 10am.

I went here about a week ago with the boy for breakfast. It was a cloudy day here in Phoenix, and we made the mistake of sitting out on the covered patio. It would have been LOVELY since it was nice and cool outside, but after we received our drinks (me, iced tea; the boy, freshly squeezed oj) and our basket o' mini muffins, it started to POUR.

The "covering" thing they have over the patio is more of a mesh to filter sunlight, as opposed to an actual solid covering type material. Our table starting to get super wet. We were sitting next to another couple who decided they were going to stick it out and finish their breakfast, but since the boy and I hadn't received our actual meals yet, we decided to check and see if we could sit inside.

They were happy to give us a table inside, and actually made a few jokes about how crazy we were to sit out there in the first place considering how cloudy/stormy it looked. We received our food shortly after being seated on the INSIDE of the restaurant. The boy got the farm special? country special? something like that, it came with pancakes, scrambled eggs, and sausage. I got whatever the other special was that was DELICIOUS potatoes, biscuits and gravy, bacon and scrambled eggs.

Our breakfast was wonderful. I loved how all the dishes and everything we mismatched, a very cute country look. Our server was fantastic. I'm sure we'll go back again. :)

This place is great, the parking lot was full and no surprise as to why. We were amazed with our waiter, he was quite attentive and three good was so delicious! The best part were the tiny muffins, while you wait, hit the spot with the coffee! We will definitely come again.
Poor service and food was mediocre at best. The side of potato was about the only thing I ate that was good and they show no love to veterans or military families.

I can go anywhere I want to eat breakfast and unfortunately I chose Kiss the Cook this morning.  Coffee was awful.  Waited a long, long time for our food which was delivered cold.  I don't ever send anything back to the kitchen.  I also don't go back to a restaurant for bad service and cold food.  As the waitress was profusely apologizing and taking ownership that she dropped the ball regarding our breakfast, her cell phone rang loudly from her waitress apron which clarified her priorities at her job.  I won't sign their petition to prevent the light rail from coming to downtown Glendale.  We deserve better options for dining In Glendale.  The waitress wasn't some clueless teenager, she simply sucks at her job.
Super cute restaurant with great food and service. Will go again if ever in town again.

Our 2nd. sat. ladies choose a different place every month. We went to Kiss the Cook today. Had a very nice young man wait on us. Food was good,  service fast and best of all coffee cups kept full. Reason for 4 stars is food and service. Would have given 5 but need to do something with restrooms. Not a very nice snell when you go in. Clean but yucky odor.

I've been going to this place since I was a little girl and let me tell you if you really want good breakfast and brunch I would recommend coming here. It's great for groups, bringing you're significant other or you're family here. There food is so delicious especially there little mini muffins but in the menu I recommend the toasted wheat B.L.T sandwich with egg overhard inside the sandwich with a side of lays chips. Omg it's so yummy but other stuff on the menu is also yummy as well. Also the servers are great but if you want someone very reliable & fast I would ask for Steven or Michelle. And if you ever go on the weekends I would call in and tell them to put you on the waiting list so you don't have to wait long when you get there. But overall if want a good food for breakfast and brunch I would come here Cause this place is the best.

I really wanted to like this place to support local small businesses...however, the food was not all that exciting.  The best part of the meal were the mini-muffins.  It went downhill after that.  I ordered the Cajun eggs Benedict.  The eggs were cooked nicely but the Cajun sauce just didn't taste right.  When I was in NOLA the sauce had a much better flavor and depth.  This one missed the spot.  The kielbasa tasted more like hot dogs.  
Sad to say, if it weren't for the muffins, I would have only given 1 star.  The mini muffins are worth a trip but that's it.

I love this place!! Hubby and I decided to go someplace different for breakfast. The restaurant has the ambiance like Cracker Barrel when you walk in, old fashioned restaurant. The people are nice servers actually talk to you and check on you to refill drinks. The mini Muffins are to die for and the food as well. We had the pancakes, apple bacon and sausage links with potatoes. Very delicious. We will be returning again!!

Great value and service, all the staff were very sweet. Food was just okay - I got the pancakes and they were a little raw in the middle and burnt on the outside. Probably best thing were the breakfast potatoes but nothing else really stood out.

It took forever to get seated. And then I couldnt get waited on.

I was second in line and two tables were open. More tables opened up. I asked to be seated but the hostess was one of those anal types who could not multitask. She let 10 people gather before seating anyone.

After being seated I waited and waited. Three waitresses walked by but still no service. Got fed up and left. I think it is typical for a single woman to get less attention than when she is with a man. Should have brought Big Poppa, I guess.

Kiss the Cook has always had so-so service but the good food keeps me coming back.

This dog-friendly restaurant is amazing! The food is incredible and so is the service! The dog friendly porch iusually isn't open on weekdays but they opened it up for me and my cockapoo. They even made him scrambled eggs in a dog dish. Will most certainly be back with or without my pooch. The seafood omelette was fabulous!

03/19/10

Kitschy, fun country-life decor.  There was about a 15-minute waiting time.  Lots of older citizens waiting, which made for interesting chit-chat amongst the women.  It's refreshing when a restaurant's setting allows people to feel comfortable enough to interact among strangers-- Mom and I encounter so many "closed" individuals on a daily basis at work, so this is a nice change of pace for us.  Staff here seem friendly and busy, but efficient.  At least, ours was.  One complaint: it's a bit cramped in here.  It would be nice to have a little privacy from other neighboring tables, especially when I spied a room in the back that had maybe four 4-tops, and only one was occupied.

Can't recall what Mom ordered, but I wasn't surprised that she didn't enjoy it-- the menu description definitely did not appeal to me.  Website does not list a menu, and all I can recall is that it was an omelet w/ a couple of fibrous veggies (snow peas and something else; it was a strange combo, of that I'm sure of.  Chestnuts, maybe?).  I went w/ a Belgian waffle, two eggs, and bacon.  Coffee was weak, but our server offered to brew a stronger pot.  Nice!  While we waited for our selections, she brought out some mini-muffins to enjoy, and that we did!  We both really liked the bran.  I also enjoyed the zucchini-- Mom thought she detected cinnamon (not a fave of hers), but I think it's the nutmeg she was referring to.  Then again, I may be mistaken...

Waffle was, well, a waffle.  No accompanying fruit compotes or coulis to liven things up.  I always bring my own 100% organic maple syrup, because while most restaurants say they offer maple syrup, it isn't 100% pure, but a blend of maple and corn syrups.  (If it smells like Mrs. Butterworth's, it isn't 100% maple.  Just sayin'.)  Eggs were cooked to over-medium, just that way I like 'em.  Bacon was very nice.

Cute saucer and dinner plates, lovely mini-muffins (we bought extra to-go!), good bacon, and efficient service make for a solid two stars.  I wouldn't mind giving KTC another try, if we're in the area.  Next time we'll try the pancakes and crepes!

First off thank you for a kind and happy breakfast staff!!! Second thank you for having eggs Benedict at a normal price and a normal flavor!

This place really has it when it comes to the "homemade" meal. I like the new super "Starbucks" type of new age places but I feel they put all the money into the facade and loose it in the food, quality, and staff. 

Without the constant bean counters and investors sitting over your shoulder this place has the time to make your food to order. The staff is kind and very helpful too. Also great coffee constantly refilled. 

There was a small problem with our meal and within 5 minutes there was a replacement plate and some extra stuff to take home. :)

All things considered this was a great dining experience and I would recommend this place and its people to serve you great meals! 

Love it and will be back!

Everything about this place was Superb! Waited less than 5 minutes for breakfast on a Sunday and never had an empty cup of coffee. Portions were perfect and prices are reasonable. Will definitely be back!

This is a true home town favorite. I have been going here ever since I was a little girl. The food here is delicious and has the real home cooked style, the little bran muffins are my favorite! I really feel at home when eating here! Especially with all the mix matched dishes :)

Great Food & Great Service all for the Perfect Price.

Kiss the Cook offers you the small town feel of your local breakfast cafe but with this country hospitality through the nick-knacks and woven baskets for sell. The menu offers the basics of any small town brunch style restaurant and for the quality, I'd say the price is unbeatable. One of their trademarks seems to be their small muffins, and I'll admit they are pretty darn good! Not the only thing I'd come here for by any means but defiantly never have a problem eating the ones they sit in front of me ;)

One thing to keep caution for is the wait. The parking lot is rather small and the restaurant is much smaller.. so even on a typical weekday for brunch you'll find yourself waiting 30 minutes or longer

Great breakfasts place! I love it it's so unique and made from scratch it's so affordable $10 per person with free muffins love it! The waiter was great  one of them was not so great she was the cashier but everything was great I bought a mug pricey but it's koo :)  the cooks combo rocks!

Awesome place. The pancakes are delicious. The staff and atmosphere were absolutely terrific. You can actually Kiss the Cook. A table next to me had the Chef come out, gave him a huge hug and kiss on the cheek.  The restaurant clapped and cheered!  What a wonderful memory  : )

I had been waiting to try breakfast at this place for awhile. We visited on a Sunday around 11am. Waited about 15 minutes. As soon as we walked in, we were not greeted. Then the lady finally said "what's your name and how many?". After we gave her the info she never said anything else she just ignored us like we weren't standing there then asked the next person the same thing. I thought it was very rude to be honest and I wanted to leave but my boyfriend wanted to try the food also. The waitress was nice. The food took some time to come out. Muffins were nothing special. You don't get much food. I ordered the huevos rancheros and I took one bite and did not touch the rest. They had huge tomatoes in there with oinions and big pieces of bell peppers which I never seen on huevos rancheros. All I ate was the potatoes which tasted like bacon or sausage (This is a problem because I dont eat pork). We will not be returning.

I am happy to live close again because now we can enjoy Kiss the Cook's awesome muffin basket, great service and delicious food at a good price. We have been eating here for years and we're always impressed. I love the eggs Benedict so much...I literally want to kiss the cook! If my wife will let me. And if the cook is female. If not then my wife has a kiss for the cook? Let's just say we highly recommend Kiss the Cook.

It was a Sunday afternoon 1ish, hubby and i woke up way late lol, and we wanted some good breakfast food. Got on yelp and found kiss the cook. probably would not have stopped if I hadn't found it on here. The building is kind of older and not a big eye catcher. The inside is really nice and cozy though. got the food to go, took it home and was pleasantly surprised at just how much food we got for the money we spent.

Went there recently on a Saturday afternoon because of some research here on yelp.  I love breakfast food even though I have it about once a month.  I could not complain about my experience whatsoever, great food, great prices, good service, and a cozy atmosphere.  Definitely not the Denny's experience which I thought this place would be.  My only complaint is the location, I enjoy downtown Glendale, but this place is a little ways from it next to tattoo parlors and check cashing stores.  Wish it was downtown so I could enjoy the shops after a scrumptious meal.  Overall this place is worth a shot!

Came here with my sister in law and nephew. Ha we had just left a different restaurant because we weren't fond of their food. Checked Yelp and this place came up. It's very cute on the inside and they have outside sitting (not that you'd want too in 117¬∞ weather). They have a covered patio where customers can wait. 

As far as the seating, it was quick even though it was busy and extremely small on the inside. Our server was polite and friendly and I really appreciate that about busy businesses. 

The food was really good and the apple smoked bacon was huge and crispy. The pancakes had a great flavor to it. I didn't have coffee but I noticed they serve coffee in clear glasses. I thought that was cool.

Anyway... overall good experience and will be back!

Went here for breakfast for the first time. Took my mom and my 8 year old son.  We waited a while for a table but it wasn't terrible for Sunday morning. The waitress was nice. My food was OK, my over-medium eggs were a little overcooked. My mom had a waffle and she liked it. My son had pancakes eggs and bacon.  He said the scrambled eggs tasted funny and so he only ate a couple of bites. Six hours later here he is throwing up and having diarrhea. Sounds like food poisoning to me. Those scrambled eggs must have been bad.  **UPDATE:  My son is doing better today, but my mother was nauseous this morning.  We hadn't been together until yesterday at brunch in a few weeks so there is no way they passed any type of virus from one to the other that quickly -- this must have been the food.  Disappointing because this place gets 4 stars on Yelp.

I was pleased with my food - basic breakfast - but others in the group were disappointed because they were comparing it to their favorite Bobos in Tucson.  The host was completely lost.  The waitress was good.  The basket of muffins bland.

My husband and I went here on a Saturday morning around 10:30. I did call ahead seating and when we arrived there was no wait.  The food was fantastic and incredibly reasonable. Will definitely be back.

The place has a tone of clutter. It's like your grandmas house threw up in there. There is a ton of dust on the clutter. That was a big turn off. We were  recommended their pancakes and biscuits and gravy and they ended up being bad. We did not finish our food and when they asked we let them know how we felt about the food. They brushed it off like we didn't know what we were talking about. 
I do not recommend this place at all. Everything was subpar.
Can't beat their Cajun omelette. Absolutely the best breakfast for the money anywhere in the Phoenix area. I wouldn't be afraid to bring anyone here.

Had my egg benedict and loved it!! Priced well and plate comes in big portion nicely decorated and yammie!!
Atmosphere of antique place with welcoming staff. 
Definitely coming back again!

The best breakfast in AZ and don't forget the bakers basket. The atmosphere is fun and old fashion country style. The home made cookies at the register are amazing, don't pass them up. The egg creations each day are unique and well worth a try.

What a find! It's as though Gramma (yes, "Gramma" is synonymous for ALL grandmothers) opened up her kitchen to the public and can make you anything you desire... within reason of course.

The decor is quaint and well done, the staff is sassy and friendly, and the food is epic!! I'm so glad I stumbled upon them.

Ok guys! I seriously cannot hey enough of this place. If I could I would eat this every day for breakfast. The mini muffins are to die for. The customer service reminds me of back home (Texas). The French toast & eggs Benedict are some of my favs. I crave this place daily!

I absolutely LOVE Kiss the Cook. It is the cutest little place for breakfast and I love going here.

The quaint little restaurant is decorated with country antiques and most of them are for sale. It reminds me of a place you would find in Prescott.

I have had a few things on the menu and have always been delighted. The coffee is a little week, but then again, I start each day with a quad espresso so it may be unfair for me to judge.

While you wait for breakfast they bring out a variety of VERY tasty muffins and bread... so, so tasty!!!!

Good service and prices. No complaints from me :)
This place has a back woods diner kind of feel, It's cute! But the food is nothing special. Muffins we pretty good though...

This place was around the corner from me and I HATED it, I craved their buttermilk pancakes, although everything is good here my go-to meal has always been The Cook's Combo.

I hope Guy (of Diner, Drive-Ins and Dives) never finds out about this place, it would be impossible for us "regular" folks to get a seat if he does.

Best pancakes everrrr! Like even better than IHOP! 
I love the interior. It makes me feel like I'm at Grandma's house. 
Love the mini muffins before the meal!
HUGE portions for a reasonable price!

The line is just always so loooong!
But worth the wait!

First time at Kiss the Cook. It was busy but they have coffee available while you wait. I got seated pretty quickly since I was by myself. Food and service was good. They don't give out the WiFi password apparently so if you are dining alone, bring a book.

Aw we love this place! The waitresses are so nice and personable. They take time out to talk to you. They seem to know the "regulars". I like that, gives a small town feel in a big city. The food is really good, better than home cooked!

Pecan cinnamon roll was amazing & there bacon was great according to my husband.  Eggs were good & so was the french toast.  Great ambiance with the antiques everywhere.   Nice place to go try & have a good meal & relax.

Great service, fun atmosphere, awesome food, decor is fun and the entire place reminds me of a comfy morning at grandma's house..... but with even better food! If you go on a Saturday or Sunday make sure to arrive early!! They have a lot of "regulars" that make the experience even better!!

I am a Kiss the Cook fan.  Pretty much everyone I know in Glendale is too.  I guess it's just a Glendale thing. But the food is similar to any of the other breakfast joints, but I think it's slightly better here. Not better than Chompies mind you, but better than the Good Egg.

They're only open for breakfast and lunch, but I've only ever had their breakfast items.  They have the best pancakes, scrambled eggs and waffles.  YUM.

They're reasonably priced too, so you can take the whole fam and still not break the bank.

Cute, quaint, Route 66 kind of place, kind of like going back in time... Down to Earth friendly kind of people... Ordered the Cajun omelette and the cream crepes with fruit, great great presentation and yummy too!

I wanted to like this place, I really did. It's right up the street from me and I was hoping it could be my new breakfast spot I could do my work at. The decor is really cute and country. There population of customers were mostly elderly, getting the feeling they are regulars and have been coming to this spot for years. My server was friendly and prompt. I asked for suggestions and she gave me an idea on what is best here. The wifi wasn't accessible, they didn't have the password. I ordered the eggs Benedict. It was drenched in  sauce so so so bad the biscuit was soggy and I had a hard time distinguishing any other flavors outside the hollandaise sauce. I thought, well geez they just make it that way and then as I tried to stomach this dish noticed a lady next to me had ordered the same thing and hers was not swimming in hollandaise sauce. If my waitress had been paying attention maybe she could have prevented the order from coming out or if she would have taken some time to ask how everything was she could have learned about how displeasing this dish truly was.

I'm trying exceptionally hard to be nice here.  Hence, the three stars rather than negative stars and I'll get into why they deserve three stars and not five stars.  What saves this place from negative stars or a one star.  They are a local breakfast brunch location that serves up something a bit different from your standard same 'ol same 'ol breakfast eateries or diners.

What sets KTC apart from the rest, is the home style feel - like a quilted cottage with frilly things about and hanging wicker baskets.  I feel like I'm intruding whenever I'm eating here - as if three bears were to waltz on in and it would be a Papa bear, mama bear, and a baby bear.  The baby bear being the winiest of the three, but I concur why after breaking his dang chair and eating all of his food - who wouldn't get mad?  I'd be Pi$$ed.

Anywho.  The muffin baskets?  Whaaaattt?  And they're absolutely delicious and to die for!  That deserves a star and a half right there.  The waitress staff are the golden girls and they know how to charm each and everyone one of them.  On their breaks, they crotchet more decorations for the rest of the place.  It's ongoing, and it never ends.

Service is great.  Seriously, a bit crammed - in fact, waaaay too crammed which leads me to why this place is getting the review of 3 stars.
I started my first job in the fast food industry and moved myself up to working at local restaurant's and steak houses - bussing tables before serving. 

If you have a popular location that is crammed, than you have to make up for it with efficient turn-around times on your tables.

Bussing tables.  It's not really hard.  It's not really that difficult.  And it's seriously.....did I say, not that hard?  So, KTC restaurant seriously....I'm not sure if they hire developmentally challenged kids from a local boys and girls club (I'm trying my hardest not to be insensive but I already ruined it with the Golden girls reference, so what the heck right?) anyway.....I've never in my wildest imagination, can make up the time it took for one busser guy (you only had one job pal....one job.  ONE JOB) and still manages to screw it up.) bussed one table outside - about a 4 top round table - about 6 drinking glassware, assorted plates about 6, a coffee mug, some food scraps, napkins, etc.  Nothing too crazy.  27 minutes.  

TWENTY SEVEN FREAKING MINUTES.  Did he leave to crotchet with the other girls?  Was he busy elsewhere?  Did he transform into a fixed street lamp on the corner waiting for nothing?  Excuses.  Once you start bussing a table, bus it until it's done, get it ready and prepped for the waiting bazillion people for the love of god!  This guy, seriously, took one glass with both hands...moved it to a cocktail tray that could hold no more than 4 glasses that he set outside a plastic garbage dumpster with lid - than, proceeded to lurch himself towards the table for aaaaannnnnnoooooooootttttttttthhhhhhhhhhhhhheeeeeeeerrrrrrrrrrrrrrr glllllaaaassss ccccccuuuuuupppppp.  By the time you were done reading that part, he would have been only halfway reaching for that glass cup.  Yeah, no joking here folks.  My jaw dropped.  He had help from a Golden girl, but she couldn't do all the work for him.  My lovely wife informed me, "maybe they just don't have bus tubs..." I was like, "yeah...buuuuutt" and as she said that.....Another busser from inside came outside and he had a bus tub.  I was like, okay....so, they have just that one slow guy right?  Wrong.  Even bus tub busser was having a hard time helping out cleaning the table.  Seriously?  They would leave entirely and not return until later and take a glass off or two.  Inside, was probably ten minutes faster, but they left tables open with an hour and half wait - seriously?  What is Beavis and Butthead doing?  Why is there no sense of urgency to clear a freaking table - you're losing customers or their patience. 

Okay, I'm fine......seriously, we finally got seated after my children had already grown older and we no longer needed any children's menus.  They were adults now.

Good, we could have that chat that I been meaning to talk to them about.  My girls WERE 4 and 6.  Were.  

Seriously Kiss the Cook - you guys have something special going on.  The food is excellent and you guys do honor Entertainment book coupon, and have such nice staff.  You have a cozy place but your parking sucks.  (hint to those driving around in circles in the parking lot - go to the lot just west of you; you're going to have to leave the parking lot first and than go to the street and go back into the 50,000,000 sq ft empty lot that is mere feet from the actual restaurant) - walk a foot or two, it aint going to kill you peeps.) 

But, clean off those tables and get things turned around quicker...seriously!  It could be sooo much better and I want it to be.  I'll be back again with a coach's whistle and stop watch  on my next visit.


Seriously, bussers only have ONE JOB.....ONE!!!!

First time I have been there in years. My breakfast was pretty good and reasonably priced. Coffee was great with Sugar in the Raw (a great condiment). The pecan cinnamon roll was very yummy. We were there at 11:45am and were seated right away, drinks delivered, order taken, and food delivered within minutes. Overall...Thumbs Up!

Do not go here.The service is awful, no one comes to table, others got served first, no water,no utensils, after 45 mins, we gave our order & eggs & potatoes were not cooked, corn beef hash was from a can, not cooked, never go back, no one helped us!!
Place does not care.  The review is true, so correct the problem,DO NOT be Mean to the Reviewer

Food:  Good.  Their muffin basket with mini muffins is really yummy.  3 different kinds, baked fresh.  They give you the basket with so much butter packets I was shocked.  But it was funny enough to take a picture.  Pancakes are Superb.  Light, fluffy, the right temperature, not DRY, and not too soggy... YUM!!!  Their famous potatoes are pretty good, not the best but pretty good.  Regular eggs are ok.  The omelettes are fluffy. The egg yolk ones are firm, the egg white ones are a little too fluffy almost runny.  They have a bunch of other options on the menu like make your own omelettes, huevos rancheros, sandwiches.  Not overally oily.
Price:  Decent.  About $5 for 2 eggs, muffins, 2 biscuits with gravy, gradmas potatoes.  About $7 to $8 for make your own omelette.  
Decor:  I love the ambience here, it is really quaint, not old scary really nostalgic, but more prairie, baskets hanging, green vines, white linen, and daisy flower kind of feel.  Has a patio
Service:  Very good.  Super nice and attentive.  Fast service.  Ask us if we needed anything a lot.

Average food, small portions and overpriced.
The service was good, cute setting. I am not sure that it's worth returning though

A "home cooked" meal. No frills, not much for spices but a  decent breakfast. Mom had the 3 egg omelet which was full of her 3 toppings, good portion. I had the country breakfast with scrambled eggs & cheese & added a side of crispy bacon. Both were good. Comes with biscuit & gravy & potatoes, though they forgot my potatoes (they were brought after I asked). B & G were nothing to get excited about, though we may be B & G snobs but there wasn't much flavor & they had a cafeteria style to them. Hubby ordered the "hay stack" & was hugely disappointed & underwhelmed. It is a layer of hash browns topped with choice of eggs, sausage links, more hash browns topped with country gravy & a sprinkle if cheese. We were expecting a generous portion of goodness & it was in a little crock dish :-( Thankfully our portions were generous so we shared eggs & potatoes & half my biscuit to fill him up.
Server was extremely kind & attentive though a little slow overall outside. With the many choices the area has to offer, likely we won't return.
Place is cute. I ordered country dish and the gravy had no flavor. Second order was green chile guevo rancheros were good.

I've been going here occasionally and the food has always been great. My favorite is the Cajun Benedict! The staff is super friendly and the bakers basket is bomb! Would definitely recommend going here, but it can get busy in the mornings. Otherwise great breakfast joint!

This place makes me feel like I'm spending time at my grandma's house. Waitresses are sweet as pie and make you feel like you are their kids/grandkids. Plenty of options on the menu including three kinds of Eggs Benedict! Not the cheapest meal in town but I'll pay a little extra for great food and great service.

Kiss The Cook has one of the best (if not the best) eggs benedict I have ever had, given that I'm a huge fan of eggs benedict. The gravy is amazing! Sausage is not too salted (which is usually the case at other places) and eggs are perfectly poached in a way that yolk is still runny but doesn't spill all out when cut. The mini muffins offered before the meals are ridiculously delicious - not too sweet, not too oily, and not to filling. I would definitely come back if I visit Arizona again.

Another great Yelp discovery! We were looking for a breakfast place within easy driving distance of the stadium and thought we'd give Kiss The Cook a try. Super homey little restaurant with tons of nick nacks on the walls. Not in a corporate chain kind of way but in a grandma's house if your grandmother was a bit of a hoarder way. It was all very cute. Although the place was packed we only had to wait a few minutes for a table. The waitress was incredibly nice and efficient. Everything on the menu looked appetizing. I settled on the special of pork chops and eggs, the pork chop was really well seasoned. The coffee was even good. I find most restaurant coffee to be too weak but it was just about perfect. Also I should add that they gave us a basket of freshly baked mini muffins for an appetizer. Any place that does that is okay by me.

Kiss the cook is one of those places where it seems like a 50/50 chance that you will either have a good experience or an OK one. Judging by the initial reviews you would think this place is the go to breakfast place.  That isn't the case.  Its OK.  Nothing special nothing great.

First off the service is lousy.  I have been told that you should always tip the most at breakfast.  Why?  There is something about going to a place and seeing empty tables that erks me when the hostess puts your name down and there is a wait.  Be it 5 minutes or 20 if there are empty tables sit the customer down.  I know that they try to evenly distribute customers to waitress for tips and what not but give me a break.  This place is not that big.  To be fair when we finally sat down our waitress was pretty nice.  

After seating it took about ten minutes for the waitress to take our order.  I got the corn beef and hash and my fiance got the kiss the cook special.  The corn beef was good.  The portion size however was maybe a scoop full.  Kind of disappointing.  It came with two eggs and potatoes.  Again portion size not too great.  The food was good though I like the southwest seasoning that you can put on it.  My fiance got 2 eggs 2 pancakes and sausage.  Her pancakes were pretty thick and the eggs looked good.  It was perfect portion for her.  The food came with a mini muffin basket which was cool and apple butter.  The coffee looked a little watered down but overall tasted OK.  They didn't have splenda but sweet and low was fine.  

Overall the experience was not much different then Denny's or village inn.  The food was OK nothing fancy.  This is either a place that you will absolutely love or just say ehh.  If your in the mood for a big breakfast don't come here.  If you want to leave filling just right this is the place.
Love this place. Everyone so friendly, food very good. I have ordered pies, they are delicious, plus saves me from having to make them. This is the place to go.

This was my dad's go to breakfast place when he lived in this part of the Valley. 

He loved all things breakfast there.. but especially eggs benedict. 

When I went to visit, I always got an omelet. Huge and yummy. 

Coffee? not bad. Not Portland, but not bad.

After all these years, I finally came and tried this establishment.  The parking spaces were limited.  Watch where you park!   

A long line was already out the door waiting for a table. Why are brunch places always so busy?  The decor reminded me of Glendale's antique shops. They have a bunch of baskets hanging and other random items surrounded the restaurant. Its interesting decor. 

Upon entering the restaurant, there was a strong burnt odor in the dining area.  I'm assuming their vents weren't working. 

I had the Country Breakfast with 2 eggs, biscuits & gravy, and fried potatoes. The biscuits & gravy didn't taste fresh and homemade. Fried potatoes were basically scorched.  They were tasteless and hard.  It helped when you sprinkle with plenty of black peppers.

The staff was efficient and friendly.  I love a place still give out free warm muffins. I would return just to order the basket of muffins. It was absolutely delicious.
Excellent breakfast special.  I am visiting from out of town and read some great reviews for their breakfast here.  I was not disappointed.  Great service and a nice atmosphere.
Yummy food! They gave us Hersey kisses with our check!  Adorable country-store like decor

So you have to love breakfast.  It is a great meal that really begs for creativity.  There are so few places that have creative breakfasts (Palette was one) but most places just do the standard fare.  That would be Kiss the Cook.  Nothing special about it.  No magic applewood smoked turkey sausage with kumquat glaze, no french waffels - just your standard stuff.  They do it well though.  Think of it as basic breakfast without the grease.  

The waitresses are great and have a ton of personality.  They really make this place a Four Star establishment.  The mini muffins that come before your meal is always a saving grace and they are the perfect size to tide you over till your food arrives.  That being said, your food won't take too long and you will get plenty of it.  

I tried the french toast with a side of ham.  The toast was decent; with a hint of cinnamon.  Nice but not amazing.  The ham was a really good size and it tasted damn good.  The fresh squeezed OJ wasn't as good as Matt's but it was better than something from a carton. 

I'd go back here if I was out in Glendale for breakfast.  A great place with a ton of character.  The food isn't overwhelming but it is good enough for breakfast.

The country plate taste excellent with great flavor and plenty of food. Great prices for what you're getting. Waitresses were all pleasant and attentive. Only bad thing we experienced at the time was the ranchero sauce sucks.

This place is the cutest ever. Very antiquey. Lolz. Buckets, bins and basket as a decors. The tables and chairs are old, country and vintage style, it coordinate with the place so well. 
Omggg. The muffin is to die for. We killed it once it hit the table. Haha. It was so fresh and hot off the oven.
Our waitress Mercy was so kind and didn't mind that my nephew Ky made a mess. Lolz. The food was on point and everything was glorious :) highly recommended.

 Perfer CASH FOR TIP.
Had the basic eggs and sausage.  Undercooked and sausage was way too salty.  They missed it on the eggs, sausage, and potatoes.  Cook seems rushed.

Great service and the food was excellent.  Love the little muffins they were delicious.  Will be going back and it is nice they have outside setting so you can bring your dog.  Just need a better sign saying that you need to sign in for the waiting list.

Absolutely amazing little place. Food was wonderful. Mini muffins were delectable. Bacon was an it undercooked as I like it crispy but everyone's different. Biscuits and gravy were amazing. Scrambled eggs were good. Coffee was good. Maggie my waitress was very attentive and always made sure my coffee cup was full. Will absolutely be coming back.
Adorable and delicious diner that is such a delight. The food is scrumptious and the staff is warm and it feels like home. I will definitely be back when I come through the area.
I am for sure coming back! Great customer service and food! I recommend ordering the French toast and the potatoes.
The atmosphere was okay, but the food 2as pretty good. We were seated rather quickly considering it was Easter Sunday. The cinnamon coffee was pretty good; went well with the famous muffins.

Charming place.  The food is good.  I had the cooks special with pancakes, eggs and bacon.  I also had their potatoes.  The potatoes could be better.  Everything else was good.  The best part is the muffins you get upon being seated and the freshly squeezed orange juice.  This place attracts a lot of older people.  We were probably one of the youngest in the room.

After attending an event in downtown Glendale, my friend and I had brunch here today and loved it. We loved the antique look and feel of the restaurant and did not have to wait to be seated. The waitstaff was friendly and eager to serve. The mini muffins were fantastic and our food was delivered quickly. We both had the breakfast that served 2 eggs, bacon or sausage,  pancakes and we both added the potatoes. I was pleased that they had turkey sausage to substitute for regular sausage. The feed was tasty and the price was excellent. We got out of there spending $10 each including tip. I will definitely be back.

I like it here. Small place that was packed when I walked in. Got my food quick and had excellent service by Susan. I just wanted a simple breakfast and it tasted wonderful. Definitely a good spot to go to for quick food.

This restaurant makes you feel like you're visiting your grandparents (in a GOOD way). The old decor/antiques allows you to feel right at home! The food is amazing! I had the eggs Benedict with chorizo and it was perfect. The basket of muffins were delicious as was the pecan cinnamon roll!!!

I know I seem like a crazy person who can't make up my mind on this restaurant, but I think I'm done with it. Went here a few more times in the last 6 months or so, the eggs florentine went south.... eggs not cooked correctly, hollandaise was gluey... produce not so fresh. Went last weekend, got two eggs and bacon with potatoes. The eggs were cooked well but flavorless... the whole plate was flavorless. I broke up pieces of bacon and mixed it with the potatoes and put the eggs on top.... still not good. The potatoes were undercooked, crunchy still, and had no seasoning whatsoever, it was just a bland pile of grease... yuck. On top of that, we waited over 30 minutes for a table. I don't think I'll be back, there are too many good breakfast places around to continue to go to a bad one.


PS The service here continues to be very friendly, so that is a plus.

Kiss the Cook knows how to do breakfast!  Everything was so FRESH and TASTY.  Mini muffins were warm and tasty.  FRESH squeezed OJ was AMAZING!!  Our Omelets were-out-of-this-world and the CINNAMON ROLL was the bee's knees.  If you are searching for OUTSTAND breakfast, KISS the COOK is your spot!!

This is the Best breakfast/Brunch restaurant. My first visited here was wonderful so I decided to return the next day and I was greeted with the same waitress Ms. Nancy. She suggested the egg nog French toast which was AMAZING! she was very attentive, and so kind! This is my new spot! I highly recommended this place. When you go there ask for Ms.Nancy, she will take good care of you. :)

My cousin took me to this place, and it's dead on. Cute little place with good food, good service and a pleasant atmosphere. They serve out a little basket of toasty warm muffins before you even eat.

The portion size is perfect unless you order a delicious pecan cinnamon roll.

Enjoy!

The hubby and I were going out for breakfast but we realized the place we wanted to tryout was closed, so we decided to stop here.

We got seated right away.  I have driven passed this place numerous amounts of times but once you walk in, it was definitely not what I expected.  This place was quite quaint.  I liked it.

Our server was really, really sweet.  My husband ordered their special French toast with orange something and cream cheese...it sounded really good.  I ordered the biscuits and gravy.  They brought us a muffin basket and those mini muffins were really tasty.

Our food comes out and my husband hates it.  He says it tasted like imitation orange flavoring.  Of course I had to try, to me it was really strong on the orange maybe too much zest....I don't know.  My food was real good.  I wanted my eggs over-medium...they were much more runny than I like.  The biscuits and gravy were decent, not Crackle Barrel but good.

So needless to say, I saw that face of disappointment on my husband and I knew that there was no way I would be able to enjoy the rest of my meal.  So I hurried and ate what I could, paid and drove his butt to McD.

My Stepmom and I chose this place because of its name and the yelp reviews. The food was really good. The Cinnamon coffee is a must! So is the Pecan Carmel roll. My stepmom and I really enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant. I gave it 4 stars because service was iffy in a nearly empty restaurant.

I went here a couple days ago for breakfast. First of all there decode and mugs are adoreable. Usually I would go with the biscuits and gravy but for some reason my tummy settled on the Belgian waffle w mixed berries , and boy am I glad I did it was dekicious and very affordable. My boyfriend ended up going with the biscuits and gravy (the reason were together) lol but I did not like them I'm not quite sure how to explain the taste but it was not good. There coffee was French vanilla and delicious!

As I write this review, I'm trying to think why I wouldn't give this place 5 stars. Today was my first time visiting this restaurant which is conveniently located less than a mile from my new beau's home. So we'll start with four stars until I have at least 5 visits under my culinary belt.

In the 9 and 3/4 years that I have resided in Arizona, for the first time, I have found a breakfast place I can call "home".

Let me start with the bacon. 

When I ponder going vegetarian, I am only halted from executing said diet merely because there is no way on Mother Nature's Great Green Earth that I could/should/would ever give up my beloved pork strip. All bacon is not created equal but KTC has found one of the blessed thick cut smoked bacon brands that surpass most. (Costco has a great maple bacon from Canada if you trust my bacon expertise) I and my table mates were pleased.

We all ordered the day's special: Thick-cut bacon, eggs & potato cakes($7.45). Yummers! My love ordered an additional order of french toast ($4.50) with blueberries ($1.50) which he generously shared with I and his brother.

The baby-sized muffins were a nice, tasty, fresh-tasting start and didn't ruin my appetite for the main meal.

There were fresh flowers on the tables which I think is a great homey touch. The food presentation was visually pleasing. The orange juice ($2.25, large) was fresh and pulpy just like I like it. If it wasn't fresh squeezed it certainly tasted that way.

I didn't order coffee cause it was "see-through" and I like it dark & strong.

I agree with one of the other posters that the food is hella fresh tasting and this is what separates it from any of the pathetic chain restaurants its been compared to. (Incidentally, if Denny's is a place you frequent, that shit should have tasted like manna from the Heavens for you).

Did you ever have bacon & eggs that tasted like old recycled lard? Ick. That's what's missing here and that's what makes Kiss The Cook special.

The service was awesome. The staff are friendly and humorous.

The decor is country cute and mismatched as one poster pointed out which lends to its grandmotherly charm.

You get a "kiss" with your bill.

Actually, I just realized, that I would give this place 5 stars if it used Organic ingredients sourced mostly from Local Farms. That can be hard when the meals you offer do not have ingredients that are available locally.

If your palate longs for breakfast food made with "Love" and flavor, support Local Arizona small business and try Kiss the Cook!
I was so glad to find this hidden gem! The food is really good, and the service is some of the best i've seen.

I love the funky and very eclectic decor. If your bored with conversation you can always look at all the different things on the walls. I had a basic breakfast which was really good. No trouble with runny eggs or over cooked. The dinner ware did not match which is all a part of this eclectic atmosphere. The place was packed and the only negative thing I can say; they were short on staff and we waited a very long time for water/coffee and worse for her to come back to take our order.

We stopped by around noon for a quick brunch and had a great experience. Our server, Missy, was fantastic and ever-attentive, always keeping our coffee full. I ordered the huevos rancheros which came with a basket of delicious muffins and home style potatoes. I thought the serving size was perfect; definitely enough to keep me sustained for awhile!

There were only two things that I was disappointed with: 1)my huevos rancheros were a bit bland and did not have much heat and 2) there was no free Wi-Fi as indicated on Yelp.

This place was so delicious!! My husband ordered one of their cinnamon rolls which was absolutely fantastic. I ordered the French toast which was amazing as well. Their coffee was great, too. They served us a small basket of mini muffins to start which were hot and fresh out of the oven. Such a great atmosphere and the service was great although a little slow. Would definitely recommend otherwise!

Like Cracker Barrel except slower service and slower food prep time, and a paucity of seating.  The building is extremely long and narrow from the outside view, thereby leading to expectations of a roomy interior but then you get inside and feel tricked.  There's a small counter and cluttered waitstaff area that takes up a good chunk of the non-cooking area inside, and then what looks like a living room sized seating area is all that's left.  On a Monday morning I was barely able to get a table.  I can't imagine the weekends.

Food was above average, prices were fair, but I thought the portions were too small.  For $5 it's a very small stack of 3 pancakes, and you're not eating into the profit margin much by having them actually fit the entire surface of the plate.  My order was more like the side order that you get for free with an omelette purchase at IHOP, except that the pancakes were spread out on the plate instead of stacked up straight.

And the place does have that Cracker Barrel cute country feel to it, but the old part of Glendale isn't convenient for most of us, especially this portion that is immersed by used car dealers, pawn shops, and homeless pedestrians.
Good ole fashioned homestyle cooking, friendly staff, good prices, try the muffins, you'll love em!

Horrible customer service.  The owner straight lied to us and blamed her waitress for something that was up to her. She actually tried to break down market prices of pork chops to us...wth??? 
The special of the day, which was on display on the front chalkboard sign, was a two pork chop breakfast for $11.95. I ordered that and was informed they only had one pork chop left. I told them I would take the one and our party  (6) all ordered.  Our food was blah, as was the coffee. When our check arrived I was charged for a different breakfast ($10.95)plus a side meat of 1 pork chop ($7)!! When we pointed out how this didn't make sense the owner told us since we didn't get the 2 pork chops we were charged market price for 1. We pointed out the sign and were told it didn't apply even though it fell on them. She had the nerve to remove 40 cents from the bill. This was the most insulting dining experience of my life.
Food was good. Service was horrible. It was a busy day but it should take asking 3 times to get straws and silverware. Also had to get are reheated.

This is a place we frequent farely often. They serve homestyle meals like your mama makes. The restaurant is set up cottage style - best description. The staff are always friendly and helpful. They have small warm homemade muffins. Very good with homemade apple butter. Today was new dish for me. New Orleans style Omlette with spicy hollandaise sauce. Very flavorful.
They have items around the place for sale. Mainly antiques, but also some nice mugs.

this is a good breakfast place. i especially love their cajun style benedict. big servings and good food. you might want to arrive early during breakfast hours as the place can get quite busy. servers are friendly. the only thing is that space is quite tight.

My husband and I always drove by this place and always wanted to try it well today we did and we will be back again! Welcoming staff with amazing service!  The mini muffins are great the waffle and eggs were perfect it was all around great! Keep up the good work!

Kiss the Cook is ok place to eat. Nothing fancy but the atmosphere is cozy. This restaurants plates, glasses, chairs, etc don't match each other and this gives it a homey feel. There is usually a waiting line to get a seat mainly because the restaurant isn't too big. The food is ok just not my type of breakfast food.

Every meal comes with a kiss, we were informed shortly after sitting down. I was going to ask if we had to cook our own food or how that whole thing worked out, but didn't.

KTC was a solid 3 stars for our breakfast this morning. I ordered the Canjun Bene; Paul, the Belgian waffle; and Jason, the biscuits and gravy. Three orders of mini muffins arrived shortly thereafter, with real butter and apple butter that was at the table. As others have stated, the muffins were great. Our meals arrived in a timely manner and we all dug in. Paul polished off his waffle promptly while Jason and I slowly enjoyed our meals. I honestly have to say I wish I didn't eat so many muffins because I wasn't able to finish my eggs, which were wonderful. The creole seasoning added to the Hollandaise sauce added a terrific flavor and just a little heat.

The decor made me feel like I was back home in Northwest Ohio. That doesn't add the the appeal for me, but some enjoy those things.

While service during our meal was attentive (I drink a lot of water during a meal and their glasses were pretty small, but I was refilled several times). However, after our plates were cleared, we sat around for almost ten minutes before we could flag down our server for the bill. Which was when we also received our kisses. Hershey's Kisses. Cute, but I rarely eat candy. Still, cute.

Met a friend for breakfast, early on a glorious summer day. Arrived about 8ish with only 2 tables occupied, but when we left about an hour later the place was hopping with a older, much older crowd.

Seated right away, greeted and asked if we wanted coffee. I would have had a iced flavored but they were out that morning, so ice tea it was. The tea was perfect. Drinks arrived minutes later along with a basket of mini muffins. 

Both ordered the 2 egg combo, mine over easy, hers scrambled with bacon.

It took about 10 minutes for our food to arrive. Picture perfect except for the puddle of "butter" on the top of my eggs. Bacon and Grandma potatoes both a mix of crispy and soft.  Drinks refilled.

The place has a homey vibe with everyone, even fellow customers happy and sociable.

Was my breakfast perfect, no, was it good...yes, above average. Prices competitive with chain breakfast joints.

I will return and next time try the eggs Benedict, the lady at the table next to me had it and it looked amazing.

Parking easy too. A enjoyable morning.

We weren't in the mood to go to some boring chain and we weren't having a whole lot of luck searching for breakfast places because we had already been to most of them.  After getting a little deeper in the search, the husband suggested this place.  

I was immediately surprised when we walked in by the sheer amount of tables and chairs they managed to pack into this tiny little restaurant.  This is definitely not a place to come and eat if you have personal space issues.  While it was extremely busy inside we were immediately seated at a tiny table for two and greeted by a sweet lady named Sue.

I ordered the Country Breakfast with Bacon so I could try a little of everything that this place had to offer.  My meal came with 2 eggs, bacon, biscuits and gravy, fried potatoes, and the awesome little muffin basket everyone has talked about.  The little muffin basket served pre-meal like bread at an Italian restaurant is why I give this place 4 stars instead of just 3.  Everything else was average but good.

The prices were fair, the amount of food was plentiful, and the service was quick and friendly.  I could definitely see myself coming back here if I am in this part of town.

Amazing words don't describe the food! First time here and it didn't disappoint. The restaurant is quaint and unique. None of the settings match, which adds to the appeal. Although the service wasn't the best, the restaurant was extremely busy and I think that has a lot to do with the quality of service we received. I recommend checking it out, it's well worth it.
